item.title: Fighter Ability List
item.guid: SRD/Appendix/Ability List/Archetype Ability List/Fighter Ability List/_index_.md

item.title: Armored
item.description:
Time10 minutes Target
Requirements
Effect
You put on armor.
You gain the following drawbacks:

Clinking. You may need to make Sneaking Skill Tests within True Shooting Distance of an NPC (instead of just Shooting Distance.)
Metallic. Gain a weakness: Shock Weakness When hit with Shock Damage, gain a stack of Stunned.
Prepares the following Free Reaction until the armor is removed:
Armored Reaction Time Target
Trigger
Effect Reduce the incoming Damage by 1 before applying it.
Fighter Upgrades:

Heavy(1).
The Armored Reaction can reduce Damage by an additional 1 point (2 total.)
Heavy(2).
The Armored Reaction can reduce Damage by an additional 1 point (3 total.)
Insulated.
Your armor no longer gives you the Shock Weakness. You insulate your armor or learn to use natural armors made of magically hardened wood, leather, etc.
Plate.
Add the following Reaction Trigger to your Armored Reaction:
When you are about to take Fluid Damage.
Silent.
You can ignore the Clinking drawback.
item.guid: SRD/Appendix/Ability List/Archetype Ability List/Fighter Ability List/Armored.md

item.title: Athlete
item.description:
Effect
You can Jump, Crawl, and Swim a Spitting Distance.
item.guid: SRD/Appendix/Ability List/Archetype Ability List/Fighter Ability List/Athlete.md

item.title: Charge
item.description:
Time Target
Trigger
Effect
Perform a Melee Attack as a part of this Beat. When you Pass the Melee Attack Test, deal extra Damage to the target. The extra Damage scales based on how far you moved:

Spitting Distance: 2 Damage.
Throwing Distance: 3 Damage.
Shooting Distance: 4 Damage.
When you Fail the Melee Attack Test, you gain a stack of Vulnerable.
Penalties:

Slowed. Gain a Disadvantage on your next Melee Attack if you are Slowed or using Improvised Movement.
item.guid: SRD/Appendix/Ability List/Archetype Ability List/Fighter Ability List/Charge.md

item.title: Destabilize
item.description:
Time Target
Trigger
Requirements
Effect
Inflict 2 stacks of Vulnerable on the target creature.
item.guid: SRD/Appendix/Ability List/Archetype Ability List/Fighter Ability List/Destabilize.md

item.title: Dual Wield
item.description:
Effect
You can use a second Wield Item each Round. (Both count as Wielded until your next Turn.)
Your Melee Attack gains the following Bonus:

Dual Wield. Gain an Advantage against creatures that you have already attacked this Round, provided that they were hit with a different Wield Item.
item.guid: SRD/Appendix/Ability List/Archetype Ability List/Fighter Ability List/Dual Wield.md

item.title: Flank

item.title: Martial Arts
item.description:
Effect
Your Melee Attack is no longer affected by the following Penalties: 'Improvised Weapon' and 'Unarmed'.
Gain the following Bonus on your Grapple Ability:

One-two-grab. Gain an Advantage against targets that you previously hit this round with a Melee Attack.
item.guid: SRD/Appendix/Ability List/Archetype Ability List/Fighter Ability List/Martial Arts.md

Test

item.title: Protect
item.description:
Time Target
Trigger
Test
Effect
Fighter Score:

[..6] No effect.
[7..9] The attacker receives a Disadvantage to their Ability's Test.
[10..] The attacker receives two Disadvantages to their Ability's Test.
Fighter Upgrades:

Sacrificial(1).
If the target takes Damage from the triggering Ability, you can take on half of that Damage as your own.
Sacrificial(2). Requires Level 5.
If the target takes Damage from the triggering Ability, you can take on all of that Damage as your own.
Tough.
If you take damage from the triggering Ability or from the Sacrificial Upgrade, you can halve the Damage (rounded up) before applying it.

item.title: Reckless Attack
item.description:
Time Target

item.title: Shield Bearer
item.description:
Time Target
Requirements
Effect
You equip a shield (or something similar) to protect yourself. The shield is removed using a Free Action, by gaining the Unarmed condition, or by becoming Unconscious. Removing your shield ends this Ability.
Prepare the following Action while your shield is equipped:
Shields Up Time Target Set your Shield to 2.
Fighter Upgrades:

Tower.
As an added effect, you can use the Cover Defense Ability against ranged attacks (with your tower shield counting as the half cover required by that Ability.)
Heavy(1). Requires Level 5.
The Shields Up Action can set your Shield to 3.
Heavy(2). Requires Level 10.
The Shields Up Reaction can set your Shield to 4.
item.guid: SRD/Appendix/Ability List/Archetype Ability List/Fighter Ability List/Shield Bearer.md

Time Target
Test

item.title: Concurrent Cast
item.description:
Time Target
Trigger
Effect
Start another Spell immediately that has the same Ability Time as the first. The triggering Spell Ability and the new one count as being started simultaneously and take effect simultaneously.
Example One could start the Illusion Spell, then, using this Reaction, start the Invisibility Spell at the same moment in time. The effect being that you create an Illusion of yourself at the same exact moment that you become Invisible.
item.guid: SRD/Appendix/Ability List/Archetype Ability List/Mage Ability List/Concurrent Cast.md

Time Target

Extra.

item.title: Anticipation
item.description:
Time Target
Effect
You know the location of any creature within Swinging Distance of you that is not Sneaky, even if you can't see them (due to being Blinded, them being Invisible, etc.) As such, any Disadvantage that would be applied for you not being able to see the target no longer applies.
Rogue Upgrades:

Distant(1). Increase the range of this Ability to Throwing Distance.
Distant(2). Increase the range of this Ability to Shooting Distance.
item.guid: SRD/Appendix/Ability List/Archetype Ability List/Rogue Ability List/Anticipation.md

item.title: Play Dead
item.description:
Effect
If you still have Recoveries upon losing all Health and Vitality you become Unconscious but do not die. Foes assume you are dead and will not target you directly. If any further Damage would be dealt to you for some reason, treat your pool of Recovery as if it was Vitality, losing 1 Recovery per source of Damage. If you reach 0 Recovery, you die.
Rogue Upgrades:

Recovering.
You can use the Recover Ability while Unconscious.
item.guid: SRD/Appendix/Ability List/Archetype Ability List/Rogue Ability List/Play Dead.md

item.title: Basic Ability List
Dash
item.description:
Time Target
Effect
Gain all of your Movement Range amounts a second time. This also raises your Movement for the Round.
If you attempt this Ability a second time in the same Round, you must make a Athleticism Skill Test:

[..6] Gain a stack of Slowed.
[7..] Gain all your Movement Range amounts a third time. This also raises your Movement for the Round.
Rogue Upgrades:

Speedy(1).
You can use your Rogue Skill instead of your Athleticism Skill on the Test.
Gain an Advantage on the Test.
Speedy(2).
Automatically Pass the Test.

item.title: Dodge
item.description:
Time Target
Trigger
Requirements
Test
Effect
If you do not have a Dodge Point, this Ability cannot be used. Dodge Points can be restored by using the Rest Ability.
Rogue Score:

[..6] You take 1 less Damage.
[7..9] You can reduce the Damage by 1 or half rounded down, whichever is better. You also gain an Advantage on any Save Tests the Ability imposes.
[10..] You can reduce the Damage taken down to 0. You also gain two Advantages on any Save Tests the Ability imposes.
Penalties:

Slow. Gain a Disadvantage for each stack of Slowed that you have.
Stunned. Gain a Disadvantage for each stack of Stunned that you have.

item.title: Grapple
item.description:
Time Target
Test Save
Effect
Choose one of the following options:

Grab. The target must Pass a Grit Save or gain the Held condition and you gain the Grappling condition.
Mount. The target must Pass an Edge Save or gain the Mounted condition and you gain the Grappling condition.
Move. The target must Pass an Edge Save or you and them will be moved up to 2u horizontally. You must spend Movement into your Walk equal to the distance moved or this option fails.
A target that is a Size equal to or less than you gains a second stack of Held or Mounted. A target Held or Mounted by multiple creatures uses their combined size to determine if they get two stacks of the condition.
While a target has two stacks of Mounted, and at least one is from you, you gain an addition option:

Choke. The target must Pass a Grit Save or gain one stack of Choked. Upon reaching their 3rd stack of Choked, the target falls Unconscious. If the target is Unconscious, further Failed saves will cause the target to take 1 True Damage.
While a target has two stacks of Held, and at least one is from you, you gain an addition option:

Deck. The target must Pass a Grit Save or become Prone and gain one stack of Slowed and Vulnerable.
A target remains Held or Mounted until you lose your Grappling condition.

item.title: Investigate
item.description:
Time Target
Trigger
Test
Effect
Each room or area can only be the target of this Ability once per Episode.
Your chosen Perception Skill's Score:

[..6] You don't get to ask any questions.
[7..9] You can ask 1 question below.
[10..] You can ask 2 question below.
[10!] One of your questions can be any question, provided the answer could be gleaned by one of the Perception Skills.
You can ask your questions immediately or wait, taking actions and playing as normal between each question asked. The GM will respond with basic, but accurate information. (Further info can be gained by roleplaying investigation in more specific ways. Those further investigations often won't require a Perception Skill, but may require Knowledge Skill Tests.)
The questions you may ask depend on what Perception Skill you chose:

Security
What is the best way in or out?
What sorts of creatures are here or nearby?
What's one feature that holds a hidden danger?
What seen threat is the biggest threat (to me or someone else)?
Is there a General Good nearby? If so, where is it?
Analysis
How does this mechanism or setup work?
Is a given wall an internal, external, or boundary wall?
What wear patterns do I see and which worn paths are most/least used?
Is a given item likely to be here? If so, approximately where is it?
Is there a certain type of Good nearby? If so, where is it?
Sensing
Has magic been cast here within the last hour? If so, where are the afterimages?
Is there an invisible thing in this area?
Is there an active magical effect or aura in this area?
Is that item or feature magical?
Is there an Obscure Good nearby? If so, where is it?

item.title: Melee Attack
item.description:
#loud
Time Target
Trigger
Test
Effect
Fighter Skill Score:

[..6] Deal 1 Solid/Blunt Damage. (Unchanged by weapons.)
[7..9] Deal 2 Solid/Blunt Damage.
[10..] Deal 3 Solid/Blunt Damage.
[10!] Deal 5 Solid/Blunt Damage.
Bonuses:

Beat Down. Advantage if the target is Prone.
Penalties:

Forced Entry. This attack counts as #loud when attacking an object or attempting to force your way into a container, through a door, etc.
Improvised Maneuver. Disadvantage when attempting an improvised maneuver to trip or shove an opponent. The GM will describe what may be possible and if there will be a saving throw for your target before you commit to using this Ability.
Improvised Weapon. Disadvantage if you are using an improvised weapon. The attack deals 2 Solid/Blunt Damage (unless the GM agrees that it should be a different Damage Type or amount.)
Melee Weapons. When you Wield and weapon, such as the Melee Weapon, gain the benefits described by that weapon, including increased damage.
Fighter Upgrades:

Powerful(1).
Increase the base Damage of this Ability by 1.
Powerful(2). Requires Level 5.
Increase the base Damage of this Ability by 1.
Powerful(3). Requires Level 10.
Increase the base Damage of this Ability by 1.
Reliable. Requires Level 7.
Increase the Damage dealt on a Low Score by 1.

item.title: Ranged Attack
item.description:
Time Target
Requirements
Test
Effect
Rogue Skill Score:

[..6] You Miss. No effect.
[7..9] Deal 1 Solid/Blunt Damage.
[10..] Deal 2 Solid/Blunt Damage.
[10!] Deal 4 Solid/Blunt Damage.
Bonuses:

High Ground. Advantage if you are more than Spitting Distance above the target in elevation.
Penalties:

Close Combat. Disadvantage if a hostile is in Swinging Distance of you.
Ducked Hunt. Disadvantage if the target is Prone and more than Swinging Distance away from you, laterally.
Improvised Maneuver. Disadvantage when attempting an improvised maneuver, like trying to shoot an item out of someone's hand or pin their sleeve to the wall. The GM will describe what may be possible and if there will be a saving throw for your target before you decide to roll.
Improvised Weapon. Disadvantage if you are making an improvising ranged attack with something that would make a poor weapon. The attack deals a base of 0 Solid/Blunt Damage (unless the GM agrees that it should be a different Damage Type or amount.)
Ranged Weapons. When you Wield and weapon, such as the Ranged Weapon, gain the benefits described by that weapon, such as increased Damage.
Rogue Upgrades:

Pinning.
The target creature must Pass an Edge Save or gain one stack of Slowed, immediately losing half their Movement.
Preemptive.

Trigger

item.title: Sneak
item.description:
Time Target
Effect
You become Sneaky.
While Sneaky, you will have an Advantage when targeting creatures with Abilities. Being Sneaky is also a Requirement of the Sneak Attack, Sneak Dash, and Sneak Evade Reactions.
You can lose your Sneaky status in the following ways:

If you deal damage to a creature without killing it.
If you use the Sneak Attack, Sneak Dash, or Sneak Evade Reaction and its effect states that you lose your Sneaky status.
If an NPC gains more than two stacks of the Alert Status Condition (most likely from you doing poorly on a Covert Skill Test.)
If an NPC takes a turn to act and you are caught out in the open without any cover or camouflage. (Outside of an Encounter, the GM will generally try to make it clear when this danger is approaching, like by informing you that the person appears to have finished writing their letter and is scooting out their chair to stand up.)

Trouble
item.description:
Time
Whenever using Spell Abilities that deal Damage, set aside the last die used to cast a Spell Ability as your Trouble Die.
While you have Trouble Dice, whenever you cast a new Spell Ability that deals Damage you will look at the die for the Test (the one actually used to calculate your Score in the case of Advantage or Disadvantage) along with your Trouble Die. If both are even or both are odd, you can deal 1 additional Damage with your Spell Ability. If both have the same exact number, however, you will also age a bit and suffer 1 True Damage.
Class Upgrades:

Double Double. Requires Level 10.
You can store a second Trouble Die. Once you are at 2 Trouble Dice, the oldest die is always replaced by a new Trouble Die. When casting a Spell Ability that deals Damage, you can deal 1 extra Damage for each Trouble Die that your die for the current Spell Ability Test matches. For each exact match between your Test die and your Trouble Dice, however, you will still also suffer 1 True Damage.

On a Fail, the discerning creature still knows the target creature was lying, but feels some sympathetic understanding as to why the lie was done.

item.title: Parlay
item.description:

Trigger
Requires

Gain Advantage on the Diplomacy Tests to attempt to pause the Encounter and enter negotiations. If you Fail the Diplomacy Test or the negotiations and the Encounter resumes, you gain 1 Favor.

Power.

item.title: Tap-In
item.description:
Time Target
Trigger
Effect

The target Player Character may interject (adding their own rhetoric or insights) and perform the Test on your behalf with an Advantage.
Upgrades:

Gain an additional use per conversation.
Distant.
You have learned from your friends and can channel their energy. The chosen Player Character does not need to be present (but that Player Character still provides the rhetoric or insights.)

Your agency asks you to do stuff, but you can call on them for resources. Maybe some unique items or something.
Get an apprentice

item.title: Bore
item.description:
Time

You are surprisingly boring. You lose and cannot gain Mastery in Acting, Charm, Diplomacy, and Intimidation. You gain "Drone On" as a Performance Skill Mastery.
Gain the following Ability:
Drone On Reaction Time Target
Trigger
Test Score:
[..6] No Effect.

Upgrade:

Extremely.
The "Drone On Reaction" now automatically Passes.
Lecturing.
* Gain the following Ability: Lecture Time1 minute Target
Test Score:

item.title: Detective
item.description:
Time
Test
Insight Score:

[..6] Gain 1 Clue Point.
[7..9] Gain 2 Clue Points.
[10..] Gain 3 Clue Points.
At any point during an Episode, you can spend a Clue Point to ask one of the following questions:

Is Subject A (an Event, Item, or Person) connected to Subject B (another Event, Item, or Person) in some way?
Is this Person A connected to Subject B (an Event, Item, or Person) more than they let on?
What is the most important detail about the conversation I was just in?
What is the second most important detail about the conversation I was just in?
Who, that I have already met, would have more information about Subject A (an Event, Item, or Person)?
Is Item A relevant to Plot B (a Plot-line at-hand)?
Was there a detail we forgot or missed about Subject A (an Event, Item, or Person)?
Other questions may also be asked, but the GM may refuse to answer them. When asking unlisted questions, a GM may request a list of more questions than you can receive answers for, then only answer a subset of those questions.
Upgrade:

Private.
* Gain the following Abilities: Take on a Case Time A creature in the area hires you to a case that will likely take 3 or more Episodes to solve. You can only have one active case. If you fail a case or want to drop it, you can gain a new case at the start of the next Episode by using this Ability. If you complete case to the satisfaction of your customer, you will gain:
2 Experience Points.
The GM's choice of a Fine Good or a Fine Item. Allows you to use the "I used to be..." Ability.
I used to be... Time Target
Requires Gain a temporary Improvement in two Skills of your choice (only fill their bubbles half-way to indicate this.) One of those Improvements must be placed in a Knowledge Skill. Use this Ability again to change out your temporary Skill Improvements for new ones. If you Pass a Test using one of your temporary Skill Improvements, explain the niche past experience that gave you that specific Skill. If a case becomes closed by fail or solving it and turning it in, you lose your temporary Skill Improvements.

item.title: Mundane
item.description:
Time
Effect
Set all your Exploration Stats to +1. Your Exploration Stats cannot be increased above a +1. (Warning: This will make most Abilities Fail more often.)
Increase your Sincerity Stat by 1.
Upgrade:

Whenever you roll a Critical Roll, gain a Favor.

[0!] You die.
[..6] No Effect.
[7..9] You miraculously gain 1 Vitality.
[10..] You miraculously gain 1 Vitality and 1 Favor.

item.title: Protg
item.description:
Time
Effect
You are a Protg of a powerful Patron. Your Patron will give you a Quest (created by the GM) that will likely take 3 or more Episodes to accomplish. If you complete your Quest, you can gain two Experience Points.
Flavor (Choose one):

Enchanting. Your Patron is a creature capable of powerful enchantments. They are capable of enchanting you, granting you new Trait Abilities. As examples of Quests, they may require that you push the limits of your body or collect powerful sets of ingredients or research components.
Influential. Your Patron is a creature with widespread influence. They are capable of granting you a portion of their social power. As examples of Quests, they may require that you play a direct hand in shaping the current balances of political power, weather that be by the blade or by more subtle means. Their requests may not always make sense, but no puppet can see its strings.
Magical. Your Patron is a being of significant magic. They are capable of giving you magical power in return for your service. As examples of Quests, you may need to follow leads and track down magical creatures to slay or magical items that your Patron wants for themselves (that you should not use!)
Material. Your Patron is a creature with significant wealth. They are capable of giving you powerful Items. As examples of Quests, you may be asked to steal, smuggle, or protect things for them or hunt down someone who stole from their hoard. They may also demand tribute in the form of your most prized possessions.
Note: Any Patron could request any task. The above are merely food for your GM's thoughts.
Upon taking your first Upgrade, you enter into a Pact with your Patron. While in the Pact, your Patron can grant you new Quests. Failing a Quest or making your Patron mad can bring about dire circumstances.
The number of Upgrades you can have on this Ability is limited to the number of Quests you have completed for your Patron. All Upgrades can also be taken instead of learning a new Social Ability. If ever your Patron dies, you must find a new one before you can take on new Upgrades (and your GM may ask that you change your Flavor going forward to match your new Patron.)
If ever you want to be free from your Pact, inform your GM, who will work to give you options as a part of the plot. Once free from your Pact, you can maintain your current benefits of this Ability and your Patron will no longer give you Quests and can no longer punish you. (But you are not barred from taking Upgrades up to the normal completed-Quests limit.)

Upgrades:

Diversified.
Choose a second Flavor. Your Patron has introduced you to a friend of the family or will, in the future, give you access to their other capabilities.
Enchanted(1). Requires Enchanting flavor.
Gain 1 Trait Ability.
Enchanted(2). Requires Level 10 and the Enchanting flavor.
Gain 1 Trait Ability.
Influential(1). Requires Influential flavor.
Gain a Social Skill Improvement and a Language Skill of your choice.
You cannot Fail a Rumor Skill Test.
Influential(2). Requires Level 10 and the Influential flavor.
Increase your lowest Social Skill by 2 (choose if their is a tie.)
You cannot Fail a History Skill Test.
Magical(1). Requires Magical flavor.
Choose one:
Gain a Mage Ability.
Gain one Spell Ability with one Upgrade on it. The Spell Ability should relate to your Patron in some way. You can always roll the Spell Ability chosen with a +2 instead of that Spell Ability's listed Ability Skill.
Magical(2). Requires Level 10 and the Magical flavor.
Choose one:
Gain a Mage Ability.
Gain one Spell Ability with two Upgrade on it. The Spell Ability should relate to your Patron in some way. You can always roll the Spell Ability chosen Magical(1) and Magical(2) with a +4 instead of that Spell Ability's listed Ability Skill.
Material(1). Requires Influential flavor.
Gain an Item Upgrade of your choice.
Choose one:
Change the Item Grade of one of your Items to any other Item Grade.
Gain an Awesome Grade (or lower) Item of your choice.
Gain an Item from the Special Item List of the GM's choosing that has the "Consumed" Item Tag.
Material(2). Requires Level 10 and the Influential flavor.
Gain an Item Upgrade of your choice.
Choose one:
Gain an Item of your choice at an Item Grade of your choice.
Gain an Item from the Special Item List of the GM's choosing that does not have the "Consumed" Item Tag.

item.title: Recluse
item.description:
Time
Effect
Subtract 1 from your highest Social Stat.
Gain 1 Perception Skill, 1 Covert Skill, and 1 Knowledge Skill Improvement.
Upgrade:

Forgettable.
Subtract 1 from a Social Stat of your choice.
Gain the following Ability: Forgettable Reaction Time Target
Trigger
Test Score:
[..6] The creature does not remember you at all.
[7..9] The creature knows they have met you, but cannot place where or how.
[10..] The creature remembers you.
Quick Study.
* Gain the following Ability: Quick Study Reaction Time Target
Trigger Gain a temporary Improvement in the Knowledge Skill of the Test you failed (indicate by only filling in the bubble half-way.) All temporary Improvements are lost at the end of the Encounter.

item.title: Social Feature List
Thief
item.description:
Time
Effect
You learn a special Language known as the "Thieves Cant". It counts as a Mechanical Language. If you and another creature speak in this Language, other creatures hear nothing more than an innocuous conversation of small talk in the Common Tongue.
You also gain the following Ability:
Thieves' Mark Time Target
Trigger
Test
Effect You look for hidden symbols from previous thieves written in Thieves' Cant runes. Each room or area can only be the trigger of this Ability once per Episode. Analysis Score:
[..6] You don't see any symbols. You don't get to ask any questions.
[7..9] You can ask 1 question below.
[10..] You can ask 2 question below.
[10!] You can ask an extra question from any category. You can ask your questions immediately or wait, taking actions and playing as normal between each question asked. The GM will respond with basic, but accurate information. (Further info can be gained by roleplaying investigation in more specific ways. Those further investigations often won't require a Perception Skill, but may require Knowledge Skill Tests.) Possible Questions:
What building, room, or path leads to the most valuable stuff?
Do any buildings, rooms, or paths here lead to a fellow thief or a friend of thieves?
Do any buildings, rooms, or paths here lead to secured areas or danger?
Do any buildings, rooms, or paths here lead to a good hiding place or sanctuary for thieves?
Upgrades:

Codebreaker.
You can now write ciphers. Your ciphered writing can only be read by those to whom you teach the cipher or by someone that can Pass an Analysis Test. That Analysis Test must be made with a Disadvantage if they do not also have this "Code" Upgrade.
Fence.
You know a fence. Name them and describe them and their hidden shop. You can always sell the fence stolen goods without worrying. The fence can also trade in information, forged documents, and promising jobs, though the price of said goods is up to the GM and may involve doing something for them first. If you ever steal from or cross your fence, they will know and turn against you.

item.title: Ethereal Blast
item.description:
Time Target
Summon forth a bolt of ethereal energy, dealing 1 Damage (Damage Type based on Flavor.) The target cannot Take Cover. You do not have the Disadvantage caused by targets being invisible.
Flavors:

Alluring Bolt.
Deals Ethereal/Blunt damage. The target must make a Willpower Save or become Charmed toward you. If you previously had a conversation with the target, you do not have to be able to see the target to hit them, provided that they can hear you.
Insulting Bolt.
Deals Ethereal/Sharp damage. The target must make a Willpower Save or gain 1 stack of Surprised. If you previously had a conversation with the target, you do not have to be able to see the target to hit them, provided that they can hear you.
Necrotic Bolt.
Deals Ethereal/Caustic damage. If the target is missing any Health or Vitality, this Ability deals 1 additional damage.
Radiant Bolt.
Deals Ethereal/Fire damage. If the target dealt damage to anyone since your last turn, the Ability deals 1 additional damage.
Void Bolt.
Deals Ethereal/Cold damage. Target must succeed a Willpower Save or become Frightened toward you.
Upgrades:

Damage +1.

Damage +1.

Number of targets +1.

item.title: Ethereal Veil
item.description:
Action. Close. Focus.
Envelop you or another person's body in a protective ethereal veil. Set the targets Shield to 2. When their Shield reaches 0 or is reset, the Ability ends. The target also gains a Base+2 Defense against all Ethereal damage. For all Flavors the target gains a Free Reaction:
Ethereal Shield Reaction Free Reaction. Close Range.
When your Shield takes damage, deal 2 damage to the attacker. The Damage Type depends on the flavor of the Ethereal Shield.
Flavors:

Alluring Veil.
Deals Ethereal/Blunt damage. The Ethereal Shield Reaction target must succeed a Willpower Save or become Charmed toward you.
Necrotic Veil.
Deals Ethereal/Caustic damage. If the Ethereal Shield Reaction target is missing any Health or Vitality, they take 1 additional damage.
Screaming Veil.
Deals Ethereal/Sharp damage. The Ethereal Shield Reaction target must succeed a Willpower Save or end their turn.
Radiant Veil.
Deals Ethereal/Fire damage. If the attack that led to the Ethereal Shield Reaction also dealt damage to the creature's health, the Ethereal Shield Reaction target also takes 1 True Damage as a second hit.
Void Veil.
Deals Ethereal/Cold damage. The Ethereal Shield Reaction target must succeed a Willpower Save or become Frightened toward the shielded creature and use their movement to flee so they are no longer in Close range (or as far as they can, without putting themselves in danger.)

Reaction range is 5u.

Reaction range is 10u.

Reaction Damage +1.
Retaliatory(2). Requires Level 5.
Reaction Damage +2.

item.title: Ethereal Weapon

Empower a creature's Melee or Ranged Basic Attacks with ethereal energy. The creature's Melee or Ranged Basic Attack now have a Damage Type based on the Flavor chosen as well as a bonus effect. The creature also does not have to roll with Hinder against targets that are invisible.
Flavors:

The chosen Basic Attack deals Ethereal/Blunt damage and targets must also make a Willpower Save or become Charmed toward you.
Insulting Bolt.
The chosen Basic Attack deals Ethereal/Sharp damage and targets must make a Willpower Save or gain 1 stack of Surprised.
Necrotic Bolt.
The chosen Basic Attack deals Ethereal/Caustic damage and if targets are missing any Health or Vitality, this Ability deals 1 additional damage.
Radiant Bolt.
The chosen Basic Attack deals Ethereal/Fire damage and targets must make a Willpower Save or gain 1 stack of Vulnerable.
Void Bolt.
The chosen Basic Attack deals Ethereal/Cold damage and targets must succeed a Willpower Save or become Frightened toward you.

Damage +1.

Propelled.

item.title: Mold Attractions
item.description:
Reference:
Bend Fire


Time Target
Components
Test
Regardless of your Mage Skill Score, this Ability takes effect.
Control fire you can see within range. The fire being manipulated must fit within a 1u cube. Fire manipulated by this Ability counts as a Fire Zone if it fills a cube or more of space.
You can manipulate the fire in one of the following ways:

Move.
You can temporarily move the fire 1u in any direction.
Spread.
You can spread the fire, creating an adjacent patch of fire that is up to 1u cube in size.
Suppress.
You can temporarily extinguish up to a 1u cube of flames. If this suppression is maintained for 12 seconds (2 rounds), it becomes permanent.
Colorize.
You can change a fire's color.
Animate.
You can form simple, faltering shapes in the heart of the fire and animate them. (Examples: A deer running through a forest jumping over fallen logs.)
The fire will only last in a new location if there is some form of fuel present or if you maintain your Focus on the Ability. Losing Focus may, therefore, cause a chosen effect to end. As an Action, you can dismiss or change the effect you chose without rerolling Focus. For example, you can move a flame 2u by using 2 Actions.
Upgrades:

Creation.
You gain a new options for the Ability:
Create.
You can create up to a 1u cube of fire where there was none.
Torch.
You can create a torch of fire in your hand that sheds bright light out 2u and dim light out 4u. While held in your hand, the fire cannot be extinguished by water, even if it becomes fully submerged.
Defensive.
Gain a Base+1 Defense against all Fire damage.
Influence.
Your Move option is stronger in the following ways:
You can move a fire up to 4u and have it touch up to 4 creatures as you move it. All creatures touched must immediately make the Fire Zone saving throw. You can move a flame created by the Create option without requiring additional Focus.
Intensity. Requires Level 10.
When creating or manipulating fire, you can choose to make the result into a Fire Zone with two stacks.
Reactive.
Gain a prepared reaction: Manipulate Fire Reaction Time Target
Trigger
Force the target to make their Ability Test with a Disadvantage.

item.title: Mold Lifeforce
item.description:
Reference:
Bend Earth


Time Target
Components
Test
Regardless of your Mage Skill Score, this Ability takes effect.
Control a patch of earth (includes dirt, sand, or stone) that fits in a 1u cube or smaller within your vision range.
This Ability can also be flavored to work with plant-based manipulations.
You can manipulate the earth in one of the following ways. Some of the options require Focus:

Move.
You can move up to a cube of loose dirt or stones up to 1u along a surface, provided there are no creatures or objects larger than a 1u cube on top. Moving earth in this way doesnt have enough force to cause damage. Objects that fit within the 1u cube on top of the earth being moved can be carried to the new location, or be left in-place. A creature that fully fits within a 1u cube on top of the earth being moved can optionally attempt a Dexterity Save to try to stay in their previous location. If the earth being moved is being climbed by a creature, they must succeed an Athletics Test or slide down the wall 2u. Creatures that can Climb automatically succeed all Tests to keep from being moved.
Difficult Terrain. Focus.
You can create or clear a 3u square Slow Zone or two stacks of a 1u square Slow Zone. As an Action you can spread this patch to another 1u square without requiring a new Focus.
Animate. Focus.
You can create shapes and earthy colors in the dirt or stone. These can be animated to create moving scenes. (Examples: etch the word "run" into stone, paint an animated scene of a mammoth being chased by hunters.)
All changes made with the above Focus options stay in effect only while your Focus is maintained. As an Action, you can change an ongoing Focus effect without rerolling Focus.
Upgrades:

Earthshaper. Requires Level 5.
You gain several new options for the Ability:
Shape Earth. Focus.
You can call forth or shape up to a 1u cube of earth to form a solid object that is attached to a solid surface within range. This Ability fails if there are any creatures in the way. The earth can be shaped however you would like, forming a chair or a set of stairs, etc. If your Focus is lost, the effect ends, returning things to their previous state.
Create Handholds. Focus.
You can create handholds on a 1u patch of wall, allowing anyone to climb it without an Athletics Test and without spending additional movement. As an Action you can spread this patch to another 1u square without requiring a new Focus.
Magic Stones. Focus.
You can summon up to 3 magic stones. A Ranged Attack can be made with the stones that deals 3 Solid/Blunt Damage. The stone vanishes in a bursts of dust upon hitting a target and cannot be used again. The stones also vanish if your Focus is lost.

item.title: Mold Thoughts
item.description:
Reference:
Bend Air


Time Target
Components
Test
Regardless of your Mage Skill Score, this Ability takes effect.
Control a patch of air within range. Wind or other effects created by this Ability will last until your Focus on the Ability is lost or a stronger wind effect suppresses this Ability. As an Action, you can dismiss or change the effect you chose without rerolling Focus. For example, you can move a flying creature a Swinging Distance per Action.
You can manipulate the targeted air in one of the following ways:

Create Wind.
You can create a strong wind in up to a 1u cube of air. Creatures that start their turn entirely within the wind or enter the wind on their turn must make a Fortitude Save or be pushed 1u in the direction of the wind. The wind's pushing effect is not strong enough to causes harm or to make a non-airborne creature airborne. Airborne creatures and Tiny or smaller creatures automatically fail the save. Pushing an airborne creature doesn't end any flying or levitating. Any object weighing 10 pounds or less that fits entirely within the wind is pushed 1u laterally, provided it is not being carried or held.
Suppression.
You can stop strong winds (or weaker) in an area up to a 2u cube.
Animation.
You can animate up to a 1u cube of air to create a harmless sensory effect (Examples: rustling leaves, slamming shutters, or billowing clothes.)
Bubble.
You causes a 1u diameter bubble of breathable air to stay centered around you or another creature of your choice. This is helpful for traveling underwater, through poisonous gas, or into a void or outer space. The air lasts up to 8 hours without being refreshed by touching fresh air. That time limit is halved for every creature sharing the bubble.
Upgrades:

Creation.
The Air Bubble option becomes stronger:
You can create air bubbles that follow up to 5 creatures while they are within range. There is no longer a limit to how long you can breathe an air bubble.
Intensity. Requires Level 10.
The Create Wind option can be made stronger:
You can create up to a 2u cube of wind. The distance creatures are pushed is doubled. The air manipulated by you can deal 2 Solid/Blunt Damage if the target is pushed into a solid surface.
Redirection.
Gain a prepared reaction: Redirect Reaction Reaction. 12u Range.
When an opponent uses a Ranged Action that deals Solid or Fluid damage you may inhibit their aim, giving them Disadvantage. If they roll a [..9], you can choose to have their attack hit a target within 1u of you instead.

item.title: Mold Voids
item.description:
Reference:
Bend Water


Time Target
Components
Test
Regardless of your Mage Skill Score, this Ability takes effect.
Control up to a 1u cube of water (including its frozen forms) that you can see within range. The water must not be animated or magical. If an effect below states that "you can spread this effect using a Beat, then you can spend a Beat to duplicate the main effect of that option to another adjacent 1u cube. All effects duplicated in this way do not grant additional Stacks of Concentrating.
The effects of this Ability will only last while Concentrating on the Ability. You can spend a Beat to change the chosen effect without rerolling Concentration. For example, you can move a cube of water 1u per Beat spent.
You can manipulate the targeted water in one of the following ways:

Move Water.
You can move the water up to 1u in any direction. This movement does no damage, even when moving ice.
Redirect Water.
You can stop or redirect the flow of the water.
Spread Fog.
You can create up to a 1u cube of fog, provided that it is adjacent to at least one gallon of water. You can spread this effect by spending a Beat. Your fog can be dissipated by a moderate wind.
Spread Color.
You can uniformly change the water's color, opacity, or both. You can spread this effect as an Action.
Melt.
You can melt the water.
Freeze.
You can freeze the water, provided that no creatures are inside it. When freezing a surface, you can create a 1u patch of slippery ground. Any creature standing on that surface or that walks over that surface on their turn must make a Dexterity save: [..9] They fall Prone and gain a stack of Slowed. [10..19] They can walk up to 4u across ice without another Test. [20..] They do not need to make another ice Test that turn.
Animate.
You can form simple, faltering shapes out of water and animate them. (Examples: A watery rabbit leaps from the pond's surface, running and dodging watery hands.)
Upgrades:

Creation(1).
You gain a new options for the Ability:
Create Fountain.
You can create a stream of water at a point within range that harmlessly spews out 10 gallons onto another point within 1u.
Create Rain.
You can summon a light drizzle to rain on any or all of the area up to 12u around you. The drizzle douses the area, extinguishing any and all flames, provided that they can be extinguished by water.
Creation(2). Requires Level 5.
You gain a new options for the Ability:
Create Fog.
You can create a 4u cube of fog centered on a point you can see. The fog flows around corners. You can spend a Beat to spread this effect to up to four adjacent 1u cubes. Your fog can be dissipated by a strong wind.
Create Sleet.
You can create a flurry of sleet in a 4u cube within range that you can see. Any creature within the storm takes 1 Fluid/Cold damage at the start of their turn or when they first enter the storm on their turn. The storm freezes all walkable surfaces within the cube to ice, requiring the ice saving throws described above.
Creation(3). Requires Level 10.
Create Blizzard.
Same as the "Create Sleet" option above, but with the following changes: Any creature within the storm has half vision, and you can spend a Beat to spread the storm to another four 1u cubes.
Defensive.
Gain a Base+1 Defense against all Cold Damage.
Reactive.
Gain a prepared reaction: Manipulate Fire Reaction Time Target
Trigger
Force the target to make their Ability Test with a Disadvantage.
