Test
Effect
First describe a course of action that a known creature has or may yet undertake. You cannot target the same described course of action more than once.
The GM rolls your Mage Skill and determines your Score for you secretly. The secret Score affects which "Prophecy" you will receive:

[..6] The GM gives you a "Prophecy" of their choice, accurate or inaccurate.
[7..] The GM gives you an accurate "Prophecy".
The possible "Prophecies" are:

Weal, for good results
Woe, for bad results
Mixed, for both good and bad results
Neither, for results that aren't especially good or bad
The Prophecy provided only takes into account how the described action would play out as things stand. Changes in the situation, such as such as changing up your party or equipment, are not taken into account.

item.title: Bend Air
item.description:
Time Target
Components
Test
Regardless of your Mage Skill Score, this Ability takes effect.
Control a patch of air within range. Wind or other effects created by this Ability will last until your Focus on the Ability is lost or a stronger wind effect suppresses this Ability. As an Action, you can dismiss or change the effect you chose without rerolling Focus. For example, you can move a flying creature a Swinging Distance per Action.
You can manipulate the targeted air in one of the following ways:

Create Wind.
You can create a strong wind in up to a 1u cube of air. Creatures that start their turn entirely within the wind or enter the wind on their turn must make a Fortitude Save or be pushed 1u in the direction of the wind. The wind's pushing effect is not strong enough to causes harm or to make a non-airborne creature airborne. Airborne creatures and Tiny or smaller creatures automatically fail the save. Pushing an airborne creature doesn't end any flying or levitating. Any object weighing 10 pounds or less that fits entirely within the wind is pushed 1u laterally, provided it is not being carried or held.
Suppression.
You can stop strong winds (or weaker) in an area up to a 2u cube.
Animation.
You can animate up to a 1u cube of air to create a harmless sensory effect (Examples: rustling leaves, slamming shutters, or billowing clothes.)
Bubble.
You causes a 1u diameter bubble of breathable air to stay centered around you or another creature of your choice. This is helpful for traveling underwater, through poisonous gas, or into a void or outer space. The air lasts up to 8 hours without being refreshed by touching fresh air. That time limit is halved for every creature sharing the bubble.
Upgrades:

Creation.
The Air Bubble option becomes stronger:
You can create air bubbles that follow up to 5 creatures while they are within range. There is no longer a limit to how long you can breathe an air bubble.
Intensity. Requires Level 10.
The Create Wind option can be made stronger:
You can create up to a 2u cube of wind. The distance creatures are pushed is doubled. The air manipulated by you can deal 2 Solid/Blunt Damage if the target is pushed into a solid surface.
Redirection.
Gain a prepared reaction: Redirect Reaction Reaction. 12u Range.
When an opponent uses a Ranged Action that deals Solid or Fluid damage you may inhibit their aim, giving them Disadvantage. If they roll a [..9], you can choose to have their attack hit a target within 1u of you instead.

item.title: Bend Earth
item.description:
Time Target
Components
Test
Regardless of your Mage Skill Score, this Ability takes effect.
Control a patch of earth (includes dirt, sand, or stone) that fits in a 1u cube or smaller within your vision range.
This Ability can also be flavored to work with plant-based manipulations.
You can manipulate the earth in one of the following ways. Some of the options require Focus:

Move.
You can move up to a cube of loose dirt or stones up to 1u along a surface, provided there are no creatures or objects larger than a 1u cube on top. Moving earth in this way doesnt have enough force to cause damage. Objects that fit within the 1u cube on top of the earth being moved can be carried to the new location, or be left in-place. A creature that fully fits within a 1u cube on top of the earth being moved can optionally attempt a Dexterity Save to try to stay in their previous location. If the earth being moved is being climbed by a creature, they must succeed an Athletics Test or slide down the wall 2u. Creatures that can Climb automatically succeed all Tests to keep from being moved.
Difficult Terrain. Focus.
You can create or clear a 3u square Slow Zone or two stacks of a 1u square Slow Zone. As an Action you can spread this patch to another 1u square without requiring a new Focus.
Animate. Focus.
You can create shapes and earthy colors in the dirt or stone. These can be animated to create moving scenes. (Examples: etch the word "run" into stone, paint an animated scene of a mammoth being chased by hunters.)
All changes made with the above Focus options stay in effect only while your Focus is maintained. As an Action, you can change an ongoing Focus effect without rerolling Focus.
Upgrades:

Earthshaper. Requires Level 5.
You gain several new options for the Ability:
Shape Earth. Focus.
You can call forth or shape up to a 1u cube of earth to form a solid object that is attached to a solid surface within range. This Ability fails if there are any creatures in the way. The earth can be shaped however you would like, forming a chair or a set of stairs, etc. If your Focus is lost, the effect ends, returning things to their previous state.
Create Handholds. Focus.
You can create handholds on a 1u patch of wall, allowing anyone to climb it without an Athletics Test and without spending additional movement. As an Action you can spread this patch to another 1u square without requiring a new Focus.
Magic Stones. Focus.
You can summon up to 3 magic stones. A Ranged Attack can be made with the stones that deals 3 Solid/Blunt Damage. The stone vanishes in a bursts of dust upon hitting a target and cannot be used again. The stones also vanish if your Focus is lost.
TODO: Make these their own spell?

Tremors(1). You gain one new option for the Ability that does not require Focus:
You cause a tremor that targets all creatures (other than you) standing on a surface within 10ft of you. Each target must succeed a Dexterity Save or take 1 Solid/Blunt damage, be knocked Prone, and gain 1 stack of Slowed.
Tremors(2). Req Level 10. You gain one new option for the Ability that does not require Focus:
You cause a tremor that targets all creatures (other than you) standing on a surface within a 30ft range of a point you choose within 24u of you. Each target must succeed a Dexterity Save or take 4 Solid/Blunt damage, be knocked prone, and gain 1 stack of Slowed. The surfaces targeted by the Ability also becomes Difficult Terrain that would takes 1 min per 5ft to clear by hand.

item.title: Bend Fire
item.description:
Time Target
Components
Test
Regardless of your Mage Skill Score, this Ability takes effect.
Control fire you can see within range. The fire being manipulated must fit within a 1u cube. Fire manipulated by this Ability counts as a Fire Zone if it fills a cube or more of space.
You can manipulate the fire in one of the following ways:

Move.
You can temporarily move the fire 1u in any direction.
Spread.
You can spread the fire, creating an adjacent patch of fire that is up to 1u cube in size.
Suppress.
You can temporarily extinguish up to a 1u cube of flames. If this suppression is maintained for 12 seconds (2 rounds), it becomes permanent.
Colorize.
You can change a fire's color.
Animate.
You can form simple, faltering shapes in the heart of the fire and animate them. (Examples: A deer running through a forest jumping over fallen logs.)
The fire will only last in a new location if there is some form of fuel present or if you maintain your Focus on the Ability. Losing Focus may, therefore, cause a chosen effect to end. As an Action, you can dismiss or change the effect you chose without rerolling Focus. For example, you can move a flame 2u by using 2 Actions.
Upgrades:

Creation.
You gain a new options for the Ability:
Create.
You can create up to a 1u cube of fire where there was none.
Torch.
You can create a torch of fire in your hand that sheds bright light out 2u and dim light out 4u. While held in your hand, the fire cannot be extinguished by water, even if it becomes fully submerged.
Defensive.
Gain a Base+1 Defense against all Fire damage.
Influence.
Your Move option is stronger in the following ways:
You can move a fire up to 4u and have it touch up to 4 creatures as you move it. All creatures touched must immediately make the Fire Zone saving throw. You can move a flame created by the Create option without requiring additional Focus.
Intensity. Requires Level 10.
When creating or manipulating fire, you can choose to make the result into a Fire Zone with two stacks.
Reactive.
Gain a prepared reaction: Manipulate Fire Reaction Time Target
Trigger
Force the target to make their Ability Test with a Disadvantage.

item.title: Bend Water
item.description:
Time Target
Components
Test
Regardless of your Mage Skill Score, this Ability takes effect.
Control up to a 1u cube of water (including its frozen forms) that you can see within range. The water must not be animated or magical. If an effect below states that "you can spread this effect using a Beat, then you can spend a Beat to duplicate the main effect of that option to another adjacent 1u cube. All effects duplicated in this way do not grant additional Stacks of Concentrating.
The effects of this Ability will only last while Concentrating on the Ability. You can spend a Beat to change the chosen effect without rerolling Concentration. For example, you can move a cube of water 1u per Beat spent.
You can manipulate the targeted water in one of the following ways:

Move Water.
You can move the water up to 1u in any direction. This movement does no damage, even when moving ice.
Redirect Water.
You can stop or redirect the flow of the water.
Spread Fog.
You can create up to a 1u cube of fog, provided that it is adjacent to at least one gallon of water. You can spread this effect by spending a Beat. Your fog can be dissipated by a moderate wind.
Spread Color.
You can uniformly change the water's color, opacity, or both. You can spread this effect as an Action.
Melt.
You can melt the water.
Freeze.
You can freeze the water, provided that no creatures are inside it. When freezing a surface, you can create a 1u patch of slippery ground. Any creature standing on that surface or that walks over that surface on their turn must make a Dexterity save: [..9] They fall Prone and gain a stack of Slowed. [10..19] They can walk up to 4u across ice without another Test. [20..] They do not need to make another ice Test that turn.
Animate.
You can form simple, faltering shapes out of water and animate them. (Examples: A watery rabbit leaps from the pond's surface, running and dodging watery hands.)
Upgrades:

Creation(1).
You gain a new options for the Ability:
Create Fountain.
You can create a stream of water at a point within range that harmlessly spews out 10 gallons onto another point within 1u.
Create Rain.
You can summon a light drizzle to rain on any or all of the area up to 12u around you. The drizzle douses the area, extinguishing any and all flames, provided that they can be extinguished by water.
Creation(2). Requires Level 5.
You gain a new options for the Ability:
Create Fog.
You can create a 4u cube of fog centered on a point you can see. The fog flows around corners. You can spend a Beat to spread this effect to up to four adjacent 1u cubes. Your fog can be dissipated by a strong wind.
Create Sleet.
You can create a flurry of sleet in a 4u cube within range that you can see. Any creature within the storm takes 1 Fluid/Cold damage at the start of their turn or when they first enter the storm on their turn. The storm freezes all walkable surfaces within the cube to ice, requiring the ice saving throws described above.
Creation(3). Requires Level 10.
Create Blizzard.
Same as the "Create Sleet" option above, but with the following changes: Any creature within the storm has half vision, and you can spend a Beat to spread the storm to another four 1u cubes.
Defensive.
Gain a Base+1 Defense against all Cold Damage.
Reactive.
Gain a prepared reaction: Manipulate Fire Reaction Time Target
Trigger
Force the target to make their Ability Test with a Disadvantage.

item.title: Blur Coherency
item.description:
Time Target
Requires Components
Test
The target becomes a Blurred Creature, as it is shifted into the frequencies of another plane. The target gains a Defense of 2 against all Planar Damage.
Prepare a Free Reaction:
Blur Coherency Reaction Time Target
Trigger The target can teleport to another location within Spitting Distance of their current location. This movement does not trigger Reactions.
Upgrades:

Far. Requires Level 10.
The target can now teleport a Throwing Distance.

item.title: Blur Consistency
item.description:
Time Target
Requires Components
Test
The target becomes a Blurred Creature, as it is shifted into the frequencies of another plane. The target gains a Defense of 2 against all Planar Damage.
Prepare a Free Reaction:
Blur Consistency Reaction Time Target
Trigger Replace the stacks of the triggering Fleeting Condition with stacks of a random Core Fleeting Condition. Randomize each stack separately.

item.title: Blur Sanity
item.description:
#Chants #Motions
Time Target
Requires Components
Test
The target becomes a Blurred Creature, as it is shifted into the frequencies of another plane. The target gains a Defense of 2 against all Planar Damage.
Prepare a Free Reaction:
Blur Sanity Reaction Time Target
Trigger
Test Save The target must Pass a Focus Save or gain one stack of the same Fleeting Condition that they inflicted on the Blurred Creature. Based on your Mage Skill Score:
[..6] The target can make their Focus Save with an Advantage.
[..6] No Effect.
[..6] The target must make their Focus Save with a Disadvantage.

item.title: Chronographic Echo
item.description:
#Chants #Motions
Time Target
Requirements Components
Test
Effect

While using the Trance Ability, you can see a ghostly echo showing the world as it looked exactly 1 day ago. The echo is frozen in time.
Upgrades:

Replay. Requires Level 5.
While active, the view will update in real-time to reflect past events.
Replay(2). Requires Level 10.
You can choose any time between now and 1 day ago to reveal as the echo. You can spend a Beat to update the echo to a new time.

item.title: Detect Displacement
item.description:
#Chants #Motions
Time
Target
Requirements Components
Test
Effect

Any non-sentient object in Throwing Distance that has been moved within the last hour will appear to have a slight motion blur in the direction of its movement. For example, you could tell a door has been opened, a box moved, or a certain desk drawer opened.
The blur is not big enough to show more than a few inches of movement.
Upgrades:

Ethereal Displacement. Requires Level 5.
While using the Trance Ability, you also see blurred paths where living entities have passed within the last hour. The blur can reveal the path that they moved along, their general height and build, but other details may be too hard to make out. If multiple creatures traveled the same path, even less information may be discernible.
Tuned Casting. Requires Level 5.
You can now see objects that used to be at rest within Throwing Distance, provided that that object was resting there for more than an hour within the last day.

item.title: Elemental Blast
item.description:
#loud
Time Target
Test
Effect
Flavors (Choose 1):

Acidic Bolt.
Deals Solid/Caustic Damage. If the target has a Shield greater than 0, this Ability does 1 extra damage. If the target's Shield is at 0, the target must make a Grit Save or gain 1 stack of Bloodied.
Electric Bolt.
Deals Fluid/Shock Damage. If the target's Shield is greater than 0, they must make an Edge Save or the target becomes Stunned. This Flavor can be used at Swinging Distance without Disadvantage.
Fiery Bolt.
Deals Fluid/Fire Damage. Lights flammable things on fire if they are not being worn or held. You can also summon forth the fire and safely hold in in your hand for 2u of bright light and 2u of dim. The fire can be held and thrown later as an Action or dismissed as a Free Action. This Flavor comes with the Lingering(1) Upgrade.
Frigid Bolt.
Deals Fluid/Ice Damage. The target must make a Grit Save or gain 1 stack of Slowed. Creatures killed by this Ability with the Amplified (3) Upgrade become frozen statues until thawed. This Flavor can be used in Swinging Distance without Disadvantage.
Poisonous Bolt.
Deals Fluid/Caustic Damage. If the target's Shield is at 0, they must make a Grit Save or gain your choice of 1 stack of Bloodied or 1 stack of Blunted.
Thunderous Bolt.
Deals Fluid/Blunt Damage. Removes your Sneaky status and is #loud. If the target is made of inorganic material such as rocks, minerals, glass, or metal it gains 2 stacks of Bloodied. These stacks of Bloodied can be cleared or prevented by inflicting a stack of the Silenced on the target using a Spell Ability.
Summon forth a bolt of elemental energy. Perform an Attack Test that deals a base of 1 Damage (Damage Type based on Flavor.) On a Passing Score, you gain a stack of Strained.
All Shape Upgrades are optional. Only one Shape Upgrade can be used at a time.
Upgrades:

Amplified(1). Requires Level 5.
Increase base Damage by 1.
Amplified(2). Requires Level 10.
Increase base Damage by 1.
Chaos.
You can roll a d6 to determine the Flavor of the blast from all the Flavors above.
Far.
You can target a creature in Shooting Distance.
Far.
You can target a creature in Sniping Distance.
Lingering. Requires Level 7.
The ground within the area hit by this Ability becomes affected by the elemental Flavor until the end of your next Turn. The area is a Slow Zone that, when triggering its Grit Save, also triggers this Ability against the creature, but with an automatic Mixed Score and no other Upgrades.
Versatile(1).
Choose a second Flavor. You can now cast this Ability with either Flavor.
Versatile(2).
Choose a third and fourth Flavor. You can now cast this Ability with any one of your four Flavors.
Beam Shape. Requires Level 10.
Emit a beam, targeting a straight line that extends out a Shooting Distance. Every creature touching the line when this Ability takes effect becomes a target.
Cone Shape(1). Requires Level 5.
Emit a blast, targeting a 45-degree cone that extends out a Spitting Distance from you. Every creature touching the cone when this Ability takes effect becomes a target.
Cone Shape(2). Requires Level 10.
The cone shape can now extends out a Throwing Distance.
Sphere Shape(1). Requires Level 5.
Target a location in Shooting Distance. Every creature in True Swinging Distance of the target point at the time this Ability takes effect becomes a target.
Sphere Shape(2). Requires Level 10.
The sphere shape now affects all creatures a Spitting Distance away from the target point.

item.title: Elemental Shield
item.description:
Time Target
Components
Test

Envelop the target in a protective elemental shield. Set the targets Shield to 3. When their Shield reaches 0 or is reset, this Ability ends.
Flavors (Choose 1):

Bark Skin.
Gain a Defense of 1 against all Fluid Damage except Fire Damage.
Stone Skin.
Gain a Defense of 1 against all Solid Damage except Caustic Damage.
Acid Shield.
Gain a Defense of 1 against all Solid/Blunt Damage and Solid/Sharp Damage. Prepare an Elemental Shield Reaction that deals Solid/Caustic Damage.
Fire Shield.
Gain a Defense of 1 against all Ice Damage. Prepare an Elemental Shield Reaction that deals Fluid/Fire Damage and causes the target to sheds bright light out 2u and dim light out 4u until the end of their Turn.
Poison Shield.
Prepare an Elemental Shield Reaction that deals Fluid/Caustic Damage and causes the target to gain a stack of Bloodied if they do not have a Shield.
Cold Shield.
Gain a Defense of 1 against all Fire Damage. Prepare an Elemental Shield Reaction that deals Fluid/Ice Damage.
Electric Shield.
Gain a Defense of 1 against all Shock Damage. Prepare an Elemental Shield Reaction that deals Fluid/Shock Damage and inflicts a stack of Blunted on the target if they have a Shield.
Elemental Shield Reaction Time Target
Trigger Deal 2 Damage to the target. The Damage Type depends on the Flavor chosen for Elemental Shield.
Upgrades:

Intense(1). Requires Level 5.
Bark/Stone Skin Defense +1 and Elemental Shield Reaction Damage +1
Intense(2). Requires Level 10.
Bark/Stone Skin Defense +2 and Elemental Shield Reaction Damage +2
Strong(1). Requires Level 5.
Shield +1.
Strong(2). Requires Level 10.
Shield +1.

item.title: Elemental Wall
item.description:
Time Target
TODO

item.title: Elemental Weapon
item.description:
#slowed_condition #maimed_condition #loud #maimed_condition #maimed_condition #silenced_condition

Time Target
Components
Test
Regardless of your Mage Skill Score, this Ability takes effect.
Empower a creature's Basic Attacks with elemental energy. The creature's Basic Attack now has a Damage Type based on the Flavor chosen as well as a bonus effect.

Flavors:

Acidic Weapon.
The chosen Basic Attack deals Solid/Caustic Damage and if the weapon used is organic and the target(s) have a Shield greater than 0, this Ability does 1 extra Damage.
Electric Weapon.
The chosen Basic Attack deals Fluid/Shock Damage and if the weapon used is metallic and the target(s) have a Shield greater than 0, they must make a Grit Save or gain a stack of Stunned.
Fiery Weapon.
The chosen Basic Attack deals Fluid/Fire Damage, lights flammable things on fire if they are not being worn or held, and creates a Fire Zone where the target is.
Frigid Weapon.
The chosen Basic Attack deals Fluid/Ice Damage and targets must make a Fortitude save or gain 1 stack of the #slowed_condition.
Poisonous Weapon.
The chosen Basic Attack deals Fluid/Caustic Damage and if the target has a Shield of 0, they must make a Fortitude Save or gain 1 stack of the #maimed_condition.
Stone Weapon.
The chosen Basic Attack deals Solid/Blunt Damage and the target must Pass an Grit Save or fall Prone. If the creature was standing on a solid surface, the surface becomes a Slow Zone.
Thunderous Weapon.
The chosen Basic Attack is #loud, removes your Sneaky status, deals Fluid/Blunt Damage, and if the target creature (or non-magical object that is not worn or held) is made of inorganic material (such as rocks, minerals, glass, or metal) it gains 2 stacks of the #maimed_condition. These stacks of the #maimed_condition can be cleared or prevented by inflicting a stack of the #silenced_condition on the target using magic.

Upgrades:

Lingering(1). Requires Level 5.
The ground within the area hit by this Ability becomes affected by the elemental Flavor until the end of your next turn. The area is Difficult Terrain. Any creature that enters the area on their turn or ends their turn in the area is automatically hit by the Ability again, repeating saving throws and applying effects described in the spell's Flavor. When hit in this way, the target takes only 1 damage instead of the Basic Attack's damage.
Lingering(2). Requires Level 10.
Same as Lingering(1), but targets take 2 damage from affected terrain.
Propelled.
The range of the target's Basic Attack is doubled.
Versatile(1).
Choose a second flavor. You can now cast this Ability with either flavor.
Versatile(2).
Choose a third and fourth flavor. You can now cast this Ability with any of your 4 flavors.
Add-On Shapes:
Applying shapes is optional. Only 1 Shape may be applied at the time of casting and will be applied to all attacks made.

Beam Shape(1). Req Level 10. Emit a beam, targeting every creature in a straight line that extends outward from you up to the max range of this Ability.
Beam Shape(2). Req Level 15. Emit a beam, targeting every creature overlapping the 2u wide beam that extends outward from you up to the max range of this Ability.
Exploding Shape(1). Req Level 5.
The Ranged Attack now hits every creature overlapping a 1u radius around where the attack hit. The Melee Attack can hit any number of creatures within a 1u radius around any point in Swinging Distance to the wielder.
Exploding Shape(2). Req Level 10.
The Ranged Attack now hit every creature overlapping a 2u radius around where the attack hit. The Melee Attack can hit any number of creatures within a 2u radius around any point Swinging Distance to the wielder.

item.title: Enlarge
item.description:
Time Target
Test Save
Effect
If the target is willing or Fails a Focus Save, the target doubles in size and its weight increases by a factor of eight. This increases the target's Size up by one category. If there isn't enough room for the target to grow, it instead stops growing once it has filled the available space.
If the target is an object being worn or carried by a creature, the creature instead makes the Focus Save.
If the target is a creature:

Everything the creature is wearing and carrying changes size with it. Any item dropped by the creature returns to normal size instantly.
The creature has an Advantage on Grit Saves and on any Skill Test that would benefit from being larger and stronger.
The creature has a Disadvantage on Edge Saves and on any Skill Test that would be hurt by being larger and less dexterous.
The creature has a Disadvantage on all Abilities that require an Attack Test, but can deal an extra 2 Damage if they get a Passing Score on the Attack Test.
Based on your Mage Skill Score:

[..6] The target can make their Focus Save with an Advantage.
[7..9] No Effect.
[10..] The target must make their Focus Save with a Disadvantage.

item.title: Feather
item.description:
Time Target
Trigger
Effect
Cap the target's fall speed, so they only fall a Spitting Distance each Round. The target takes no Damage from Falling.
Knowing this Ability or holding a Spell Scroll of this Ability also grants you the following Passive:

You can Jump a Spitting Distance.
Upgrades:

Light as a.
* Gain the following Action: Light as a Feather Time Target
Test
Save
Effect If the target is an inanimate object not held by anyone, the object loses all friction with the ground or surface it is resting on. While floating on this hair-thick pillow of air it can be easily pushed (as if the surface was slick ice.) If the target is an object held by a creature or a creature, the creature must Pass an Edge Save or the creature drops the object or gains a stack of Slowed, respectively.

item.title: Find Familiar
item.description: #Chants #Motions Summon a helpful spirit

item.title: Gaze
item.description:
Time Target
Components
Test
Connect with a creature's mind to perceive the world through its senses.
Mage Score:

[..6] No effect.
[7..] You begin to perceive through the creature's senses as if you were standing and looking where they are. You are unaware of your real location, having two stacks of blinded and Deafened as Persistent Conditions while this Ability is active. You do not benefit from any special senses possessed by the target creature.
[10..] All Mixed Score effects but you can benefit from any special senses possessed by the target creature.
Upgrades:

Persistent.
By spending a Beat you can toggle the effects of this Ability on and off. When using this Ability, you can choose to have it start in the inactive state.

item.title: Glyphic Basin
item.description:
Time Target
You create a ghostly floating basin of water, known as the Hangman's Glyph, on the Ethereal Layer with an associated password or passphrase. The Hangman's Glyph then works similar to the human game of "Hangman."
A creature that is within Swinging Distance and that can see the Glyph can spend a Beat to trace a letter upon the surface of the water as a guess toward the passphrase.
Possible Glyph Abilities:
Punish Time Target
Trigger Issue a predefined Glyph Command.
Clue Time Target
Trigger Issue a predefined Glyph Command.
Reward Time Target
Trigger Issue a predefined Glyph Command and either reset to a state as if no letters had been entered or dismiss yourself.
See the Glyphic Spell Rules for more.

item.title: Glyphic Lock
item.description:
Time Target
Attach this Glyph to the target. A magical lock or seal appears at the point you touched. If the target already had a lock, the Glyph can instead work through the existing lock, provided that the lock was unlocked when this Ability took effect. If this Glyph works through the existing lock you can choose whether the lock's original keys still work or not.
At the time of casting this Ability, you can specify if the target is locked or unlocked. While locked, the target cannot be opened and becomes impassable. While unlocked, the target can be opened or becomes passable.
This Glyph can be forcibly unlocked in the following ways:

By using the Knock Spell.
Attempting to force your way in and getting a High Score on an Athletics Skill Test
Using Awesome Grade Lockpicks to pick the lock.
Note that getting a Fail on an Athletics Skill Test or a Lockpick Test even once means the lock is above that creature's ability to force it open, even if they spent all day trying.
At the time of casting, you can specify a "Key Object" that the Glyph can recognize by touch. The Key Object can be a specific object (like a doll) or a generic type of object (like vegetables.)
Possible Glyph Abilities:
Unlock Time Target
Trigger The lock is released and the target of the Glyph becomes passable.
Lock Time Target
Trigger The lock is re-engaged and the target of te Glyph becomes impassable.
Alarm Time Target
Trigger Send a Glyph Command.
Auto-Lock Time Target If a predefined amount of time (6 seconds or more) has passed since creation or the last unlocking of this Glyph, re-engage the lock, making the target of those Glyph impassable.
See the Glyphic Spell Rules for more.

item.title: Glyphic Mouth
item.description:
Time Target
Possible Glyph Abilities:
Replay Time Target
Trigger Audibly replay a predefined recorded message. This message must be recorded at the time of casting and is replayed exactly as it was heard by the Echo Glyph, including its pacing, volume, and length. The volume cannot be loud enough to deal Damage. Recording messages longer than 6 seconds will require an additional Beat each Turn for each 6 seconds of length.
Debug Time Target
Trigger Audibly repeat that Glyph Command at a Noisy volume.
Telephone Time Target
Trigger Send a new predefined Glyph Command or repeat the triggering Glyph Command.
Chatter Time Target If a predefined amount of time has passed since creation or the last use of this Glyph Ability, send a Glyph Command.
See the Glyphic Spell Rules for more.

item.title: Glyphic Strand
item.description:
Time Target
Requires
You create a long Glyph suspended in the air by tracing of your finger along a given path that is at most Spitting Distance long. You can use movement as you trace the strand. As you do, you can connect it to as many other Glyphs as you see fit that are within the usual Swinging Distance to any part of the strand (including other strands.) The strand can connect to Glyphs through solid objects, provided that you have seen the Glyph you are connecting to at least once. You can also connect the strand to any Item as if it was a Glyph.
Possible Glyph Abilities:
Echo Time Target
Trigger Repeat the triggering Glyph Command. Remember: Connected Glyphs will react 6 seconds after the Glyph Command was sent.
Snap Time Target
Trigger Send a specified Glyph Command.
Tripwire Time Target
Trigger Send a predefined Glyph Command. The object or creature can be specific (like a specific book or a specific person you have met.) You can also describe the triggering object or creature using a generic description of its makeup (like an object's material, a creature's type, or that a creature must be holding or wearing an object or uniform of some type.)
Wield Time Target
Trigger Activate a connected magic Item. If the Item requires a specific Command Word, you must know that Command Word at the time of creating this Glyph.
See the Glyphic Spell Rules for more.

item.title: Glyphic Wand
item.description:
Time Target
Requires
You touch a Spell Scroll to a solid surface and transfer its magic into a Glyph attached to the surface. The Spell Scroll is destroyed in the process.
The Glyph fills a circle centered on the point you touched that can be as small as your hand up to a diameter of a Spitting Distance, provided that it can fit on the surface touched and does not overlap any other Glyphic Wands.

The Glyph has the same Mage Skill as its creator, and only one Beat per round. If the Spell Ability has target requirements, you must predefine the target at the time of creating the Glyph. If the target is listed as a specific creature or object, a line of fire can be specified instead, with the first creature touching the line becoming the target.
If the Wand Glyph contains a Spell Ability, the Glyph is dismissed after dealing Damage, Failing a Test while Exhausted, or Failing a Test while Strained.
if the Wand Glyph contains a Spell Ability that has a Concentration Component, it requires your Concentration for it to exist. If such a Glyph uses its Ability while a previous use of its Ability is still active, the previous use ends and the new use of the Ability takes over.
Possible Glyph Abilities:
Timer Time Target After a specified amount of time, start the contained Spell Ability.
Activate Time Target
Trigger Start the contained Spell Ability now.
Terminate Time Target
Trigger End the Spell Ability, provided that the Spell Ability can be voluntarily ended.
Trigger Time Target
Trigger Start the Spell Ability. The object or creature can be specific (like a specific book or a specific person you have met) or generic (like an object's material, a creature's type, or that a creature must be holding or wearing an object or uniform of some type.)
Announce Time Target
Trigger Send a Glyph Command.
If the Spell Ability can Prepare Abilities, they may be specified as Glyph Abilities. Any choices contained in those Prepared Abilities must be made at the time of creating the Glyph. If the Prepared Ability does not have a Reaction Trigger, you can specify that the Ability will be used at the first valid moment after receiving a predefined Glyph Command.
Upgrades:

Memorized. Requires Level 5.
You can create this Glyph without a Spell Scroll, provided that you know the Spell Ability and it's Test is not affected by being Exhausted or Strained. When using this option, the Glyph requires your Concentration to exist.
Expertise(1). Requires Level 5.
A Wand Glyph with a Concentration Component can be created without using your Concentration. If you do so, and the Wand Glyph targets a creature, the Glyph must roll a Concentration Focus Save each time its target moves to a new location each Round.
When creating a Glyph containing an Ability affected by being Exhausted or Strained, you can take on a stack of Exhausted in order to add a Charge to the Glyph, provided that you have less than 2 stacks of Exhausted to start with. If this Wand Glyph later fails a Test while Exhausted or Strained, a Charge is lost instead of the Glyph being dismissed.
Expertise(2). Requires Level 10.
When you add a Charge to this Wand Glyph, if the Glyph now has 10 charges, then the Glyph no longer needs to spend Charges to keep from being dismissed.
When creating a Wand Glyph with a Concentration Component, you can transfer your Concentration on an active Spell Ability to this newly created Glyph. The Glyph takes on the Spell Ability and its Concentration as if it had cast the Spell Ability. This happens when the Glyphic Spell takes effect.
See the Glyphic Spell Rules for more.

item.title: Glyphic Watchman
item.description:
Time Target
Requires
You place a Glyph that has a Hearing, Vision, and Ethereal Vision range of 12u on a solid surface you touch.
Possible Glyph Abilities:
Announce Time Target
Trigger Send a predefined Glyph Command. The description can be of an object or creature entering or leaving a given proximity. It could be a creature performing a certain action, speaking a certain password, or failing to do those things within a certain time limit. Creature or object descriptions can be specific or generic in nature, such as identifying a person you've met before or specifying that they must be wearing a certain uniform or badge.
Upgrades:

Intelligent. Requires Level 10.
This Glyph can now remember, for 24 hours, all Glyph Commands issued as well as the sights and sounds that it experienced from 5 minutes before to 5 minutes after each Glyph Command was issued.
Gain new possible Glyph Abilities: Clear Time Target
Trigger Clear this Glyph's memory.
Download Time Target
Trigger All stored sights, sounds, and Glyph Commands issued are immediately transferred as memories to the mind of any creature touching the rune. Any gaps in memory due to deactivation or the Clear Glyph Ability is readily apparent.

Paranoid.
* Gain a new possible Glyph Ability: Detect Time Target
Trigger Send a predefined Glyph Command.
See the Glyphic Spell Rules for more.

item.title: Guiding Wind
item.description:
#Chants #Motions
Time
Target
Requirements Components
Effect Duration
Present an object or pantomime an activity (like chopping vegetables or writing at a desk.) The presented object or activity becomes the target of this Ability. This Ability will then find a secondary target that is the nearest object similar to the target, or a location where the targeted pantomime frequently occurs.
If the secondary target is found, a gentle wind will begin to blow along open paths that lead to the secondary target.
If a secondary target could not be found, the breeze will simple swirl around you, leading nowhere. If there is no clear and open path to the secondary target, the breeze will lead you as far as it can.
Anyone can feel the breeze or see its effects, but will only know it is magical if they use the Trance Ability to see the wisps of magic in the wind.
Upgrades:

Named. Requires Level 5.
You gain another target option. You can speak the name of a creature. The secondary target will become the location of the nearest person that has that name as their Ceremonial Name. When this ritual takes effect, the person who's name you spoke will hear their name whispered to them upon the wind. The secondary target is fixed and does not move if the named person moves.
Limited. Requires Level 10.
You can choose to have the wind only be present and perceivable within Swinging Distance of you. (Targets of the Named add-on will still hear their name called.)

item.title: Hex
item.description:
#Chants
Time Target
Test
Effect
Mage Score:

[..6] No Effect.
[7..9] Choose a Hex from the list below. The Hex and its effects count as a Fleeting Condition.
[10..] Choose a Hex from the list below. The Hex and its effects counts as a Persistent Condition that wears off after 5 minutes.
Only one of your Hexes, can affect each target at a time. Possible Hexes:

Charisma.
Choose Deception or Sincerity. The target gains a Disadvantage on Tests for those Stats.
Health.
The target grows (your choice of) tired, itchy, or confused. Choose one of the Saves. The target gains a Disadvantage on Saves of that type.
Obstacle.
The target finds certain courses of action more difficult. Choose a Skill. The target has a Disadvantage on all Tests for that Skill.
Speechless.
Choose a word. The target cannot speak that word. Alternatively, choose one spell that requires #Chants. The target cannot cast that Spell.

item.title: Hold Monster
Illusion
item.description:
#cubic_yard #cubic_yards #cubic_yards
Time Target
Requirements Components
Test
Duration
Regardless of your Mage Skill Score, this Ability takes effect.
Choose one of the following harmless effects patterned off the five senses:

Sight. Target an empty location no larger than a #cubic_yard. Create a visual projection in the target location. The illusory image must be static (non-moving.) It produces no other sensory effects other than visual ones. Physical interaction with the projection reveals it to be an illusion.
Sound. Target a location. Create a sound that is Quiet, Noisy, or , Loud. The sound can be any sound, noise, pattern of noise, etc. This sound can be affixed to a surface and track any movements of that surface.
Smell. Target a location. Create a smell or pattern of smells that can be smelled withing Spitting Distance of the targeted location. This smell can be affixed to a surface and track any movements of that surface.
Taste. Target an object, substance, etc. Alter the flavor of the target.
Touch. Create a subtle sensation on a target patch of skin that spans an area no larger than your Character's hand. The sensation could be any touch sensation -- like a breeze that's not there, temperature changes that aren't real, the feeling that you've been tapped on the shoulder, the tickle of a bug crawling on you, etc.
Any creature affected by an illusion can spend a Beat to perform an Analysis Test on an Illusion affecting them. If the Pass the Test, they know it is an illusion and the illusion becomes perceptively transparent to them and they can choose to detach any illusions attached to them. Depending on your Mage Skill Score the creature makes the Test with the following modifications:

[..6] No modification.
[7..9] The creature performs the Test with a Disadvantage.
[10..] The creature performs the Test with two Disadvantages.
Upgrades:

Animated.
When creating a "Sight" effect, the projected image can be animated and moved to new locations. You must specify the full course of activity upon creating the illusion or use an Action to update it.
When creating a "Touch" effect, the sensation can move across target's skin.
Disguise(1).
When creating a "Sight" effect, you can affix it and its shape to a creature or object in range. If the object or creature moves, the illusion will animate and move to match. This Upgrade can be used to disguise yourself, another creature, the text on a page, the cover and contents of a book, the colors and images of a flag, etc. If your target is unwilling, they can avoid the effect by Passing an Edge Save
Multifaceted(1).
When creating an illusion, you can choose up to two different effects from the effects list instead of just one.
Multifaceted(2).
When creating an illusion, you can choose up to three different effects from the effects list.
Multifaceted(3).
When creating an illusion, you can choose any number of different effects from the effects list.
When used with the Animated Upgrade, you can create a perfect illusory duplicate of yourself or another creature. If the illusory duplicate is within Swinging Distance of the creature it is based on, that creature gains an Advantage when using the Dodge Ability. Getting a Low Score on the Dodge Ability will reveal the illusory duplicate, making it transparent to the attacker.
Larger(1).
When creating a "Sight" effect, the image can be up to two #cubic_yards.
When creating a "Touch" effect, the sensation can affect up to half the target's body.
Larger(2).
When creating a "Sight" effect, the image can be up to three #cubic_yards.
When creating a "Touch" effect, the sensation can affect up to the target's entire body.
Targeted(1).
When creating an effect, you can choose a creature in Shooting Distance that will become the sole target of the Illusion. No other creatures will experience the effect. If the target of a "Sight" illusion touches the illusion, they do not immediately know it to be fake but must perform the Analysis Test described above without spending a Beat to do so. If they Fail the Test, they suffer 1 Ethereal/Sharp Damage and must find some way to justify the outcome in their own mind, refusing to believe the illusion is fake. For example, if a creature falls through an illusory bridge, they may justify that they slipped or were pushed off. If the creature touches illusory lava, is attacked by an illusory weapon, or some other danger, the justification may simply be that the damage they took was from the illusory danger.
Targeted(2).
Damage dealt by your illusions is increased to 2.
Targeted(3). Requires level 5
Damage dealt by your illusions is increased to 3.
Targeted(4). Requires level 10
Damage dealt by your illusions is increased to 4.

item.title: Invisibility
item.description:
#Chants #Motions
Time Target
Requires Components
Test
Regardless of Mage Skill Score, this Ability takes effect, bending all awareness away from the target. The target is affected in the following ways:

They become Sneaky.
They have an Advantage on Covert Skill Tests.
They have an Advantage when targeting others with Abilities.
All Abilities targeting them have a Disadvantage if they do not use a True Distance or a Shape.
They must perform all Tests (including Saves) as Straining Tests.
If they reach 2 stacks of Strained, this Ability instance ends.
Upgrades:

Greater(1).
The target no longer has Straining Saves.
Greater(2).
The target no longer has Straining Skill Tests.
Greater(3). Requires Level 10.
The target no longer has any Straining Tests that were not already Straining.

item.title: Knock
item.description:
Time Target
Test
Effect

Unbar, unlock, or open the door, box, chest, manacle, padlock, or other object.
Note, if the target is locked or barred by more than one lock or bar, you must cast this Ability again per lock or bar to gain entry.

item.title: Lifeline
item.description:
#Chants #Motions
Time Target
Trigger
Requirements Components
Test
Effect Duration
Mage Score:

[..6] No effect. The target creature dies, as normal.
[7..] You grab hold of a thread of the target creature's life. While your Concentration holds, the creature maintains 1 Vitality, though the creature is Unconscious. If the creature is attacked, you must Pass a Focus or this effect ends. When the effect of this Ability ends, the creature loses 1 Vitality unless it was healed in some way, at which point this spell also ends.

item.title: Light
item.description:
#Chants #Motions
Time Target
Requirements Components
Test
Regardless of your Mage Skill Score, this Ability takes effect.
You create a tiny floating light within range that sheds bright light up to 2u and dim light another 2u. The light can be any color or shape that you choose.
Once a light is created, you gain the following actions:
Animate Light Time Target Animate your light, changing its shape color, brightness, and location. The brightness of the light cannot exceed the limits of the Light Spell and the location of the light must be within Sniping Distance of you and cannot pass through solid surfaces.
Sling Light Time Target Move the targeted light in a straight line to the targeted location. If the light was attached to anything, the light becomes detached from that thing upon starting its movement. If the targeted light hits a surface as it moves, it becomes attached to that surface. If the surface hit is on an unwilling creature (or an object held by an unwilling creature), the creature must Pass an Edge Save Test in order to choose whether the light misses them, attaches to an object they are carrying of their choice, or misses them and continues its movement. On a Fail, you can choose the location at which the light became attached to the creature or an object it is holding. Once the targeted light is attached to a surface, all contiguous portions of that surface within Swinging Distance of the attachment point begin to glow with the same light, shedding bright light up to 2u and dim light another 2u.
Completely covering the light and any lit up surfaces it is attached to with an opaque object, such as a cloak or a bucket, blocks the light.
Upgrades:

Blinding. Requires Level 5.
The lights created by this Ability become stronger in the following ways:
All light ranges for this Ability are doubled.
When a light attaches directly to a creature (not something it is holding) that creature gains a stack of Blinded.
Any bright light exuded by this Ability counts as a Daylight Zone:
Daylight Zone


When an #Undead creature starts their turn in a Daylight Zone or when they touch a Daylight Zone for the first time on their turn, they gain one stack of Vulnerable for each stack of Daylight Zone.
Burning.
When a light becomes attached to a creature, you can choose to have it deal 2 Ethereal/Fire Damage to the creature.
Burning(2). Requires Level 5.
The "Burning" Upgrade now deals 3 Ethereal/Fire Damage.
Burning(3). Requires Level 10.
The "Burning" Upgrade now deals 4 Ethereal/Fire Damage.
Guiding.
If a light is attached to a creature (not an object held by the creature.) all Abilities that deal Solid Damage gain an Advantage against the creature.
Spraying.
When using this Ability, you can create 2 lights instead of 1.
When creating lights, you can immediately use the "Sling Light" Ability as a Free Action.
Spraying(2). Requires Level 5.
When using this Ability, you can create 4 lights instead of 1.

item.description:
Time Target
Trigger
Requires

item.title: Planar Blast
item.description:
Time Target

Summon forth a bolt of planar energy, dealing 1 damage ( Damage Type is based on Flavor.)
Flavors:

Inconsistency Bolt. Deals Solid/Planar damage. The target must make a Fortitude Save or gain a Weakness: Solid/Planar Weakness If you take Solid/Planar damage, roll a d6:
[1] you gain 1 stack of the Polyformed condition.
[2..6] Nothing happens.
Incoherency Bolt. Deals Fluid/Planar damage. The target must make a Dexterity Save or gain two stacks of the Incohered condition.
Insanity Bolt. Deals Ethereal/Planar damage. The target must make a Wisdom Save or gain a Weakness: Ethereal/Planar Weakness If you take Ethereal/Planar damage, roll a d20:
[1..10] You gain the Fleeting Condition that corresponds with that number on your character sheet (1-Blunted, 2-Dazed, etc.)
[11..20] Nothing happens.
Upgrades:

Amplified(1). Req Level 5. Damage +1.
Amplified(2). Req Level 10. Damage +1.
Far. Range x2

Split(2). Req Level 10. Number of Targets +1.

item.title: Reading
item.description:
Time Target
Requirements
Test
Effect
Ask one of the following questions:

What are the initials (or first syllable) of the target's true, ceremonial name?
How old is the target?
What is the target's birth month (or season)?
What is the target's height and weight?
What is one minor guilty pleasure of the target?
What is the target's handedness, favorite color, favorite food, or some other fact that the target would not consider a secret?
What are the initials or first syllable of the name of someone the target loves or used to love (as the target knows them)?
What are the initials or first syllable of the name of someone the target sees as an enemy or competitor (as the target knows them)?
The GM rolls your Mage Skill and determines your Score for you secretly. The secret Score affects which "Prophecy" you will receive:

[..6] The GM gives you an accurate or inaccurate answer of their choice.
[7..] The GM gives you an accurate answer.
Bonuses:

Theatrics. The GM rolls with Advantage if you are able to set the stage and use some form of Reading Equipment, such as a crystal ball, special cards, etc.

item.title: Reduce
item.description:
Time Target
Test Save
Effect
If the target is willing or Fails a Focus Save, the target halves in size and its weight decreases by a factor of eight. This reduces the target's Size down by one category.
If the target is an object being worn or carried by a creature, the creature instead makes the Focus Save.
If the target is a creature:

Everything the creature is wearing and carrying changes size with it. Any item dropped by the creature returns to normal size instantly.
The creature has an Advantage on Edge Saves and on any Skill Test that would benefit from being smaller and more dexterous.
The creature has a Disadvantage on Grit Saves and on any Skill Test that would be hurt by being smaller and physically weaker.
The creature has a Disadvantage on all Abilities that require an Attack Test, but can always deal an extra 1 Damage if they get a Failing Score on the Attack Test.
Based on your Mage Skill Score:

[..6] The target can make their Focus Save with an Advantage.
[7..9] No Effect.
[10..] The target must make their Focus Save with a Disadvantage.

item.description:
Time Target
Requires
Test
Effect
Mage Skill Score:

[7..9] Gain a stack of Exhausted. The target returns to life with its Vitality restored, but no Health.
[10..] Gain a stack of Exhausted. The target returns to life with its Vitality restored along with half its Health, rounded down.

item.description:
Time Target
Trigger
Test

[7..9] The target can choose to set their Shield equal to half the total amount of Health and Vitality lost (rounded down.)

Upgrades:

Aura(1). Requires Level 5.
When targeting yourself, you can choose secondary target in Spitting Distance. The secondary target can choose to set their Shield equal to half the value that you set yours to (rounded down.)
Aura(2). Requires Level 10.
When targeting any creature, you can choose a secondary target a Spitting Distance from the target. The secondary target can choose to set their Shield equal to the target's new Shield.
Ranged.
You can now also target any creature in Throwing Distance.

item.description:
#Chants #Motions
Time Target
Requires Components

Effect

Open a 10 centimeter (~4 inch) wide Rift on the target solid, mostly-flat surface. Choose a secondary target that is also a solid, mostly-flat surface, but this one can be anywhere in your current universe, provided that you have been to that location and seen that surface before. The two portals are connected, allowing anything, including sights and sounds, to travel between them.
If you lose Concentration on a Rift, it cannot be regained toward that Rift and the Rift will close at a rate of 10 centimeters per Round. If there are solid objects or creatures in the way of closing, it will be blocked from closing and deal 1 Ethereal/Planar Damage to the obstruction until it is cleared and the Rift can continue to close.
Upgrades:

Far. Requires Level 10.
Your Rift no longer has to connect to the same universe that you are in.
Gaping. Requires Level 7.
* Prepare the following Ability: Widen Rift Time Target
Effect Widen the target Rift by 10 centimeters in diameter. This effect cannot spread a portal into areas where either portal of the Rift would hit an obstruction, edge, or tight bend in the surface it is on. For your reference, the following table shows how long it will take for different things to be able to move through the rift (including the initial casting time):
Hidden. Requires Level 5.

Effect The target Rift becomes invisible to all but the creatures you choose. If it was already invisible, you can make it visible instead. Unaware creatures that pass through the Rift will become aware of its existence.
Reaching. Requires Level 5.
You can instead target a secondary location that you have not been to. If you do, you gain a Disadvantage on all Tests for this Ability and if you Fail this Ability's Test, you must roll on the following consequence table:

item.title: See
item.description:
#Chants #Motions
Time Target
Requires
Effect

You enter a Trance that limits your vision range to Spitting Distance but allows you to see the Ethereal Layer (such as invisible creatures, ghosts, magic Items, active Spells, or the afterimage of Spells used recently.)
The Material Layer within range will also be visible as a ghostly, illuminated replica, even if your vision would otherwise be occluded by a non-magical Dark Zone or non-magical blindness.
While in a Trance, your hearing is unaffected, and you can easily follow Noise, though a sound may only lead you to the location where an entity last performed a Noisy or Loud course of action.
The trance ends if you fall Unconscious or spend a Beat to end it.

item.title: Blinded
item.description:
Blunted and Vulnerable.
1 Stack: You can only partially see.
2 Stacks: you cannot see.

item.title: Bloodied
item.description: 1 or 2 Stacks: Take 1 True Damage at the end of your turn.

item.title: Blunted
item.description: 1 or 2 Stacks: You have Disadvantage when using Abilities.

item.title: Charmed
item.description:
1 Stack: You are sympathetic toward the source of this condition.
You have Disadvantage on any actions you take that target the source of this condition and would affect it in a negative way.
2 Stacks: You are fully charmed. You cannot use actions that would directly target and affect the source of this condition in a negative way.

item.title: Choked
item.description:
When someone Mounts and then successfully Chokes you, you will gain one Stack of this condition. This increases by one Stack if you are successfully Choked again. If you are successfully Choked a third time, you fall Unconscious. When you break free from the source of the Choking condition (be that breaking free from being Mounted, underwater, or trapped in a cloud of toxic gas), you can recover 1 stack of Choked immediately and another at the end of your next turn. (If you have already fallen Unconscious, that condition will need to be removed separately.)

Choked(1)
You cannot speak or make any other vocal noise.
You cannot cast any Ability that requires a verbal component.
Choked(2)
You are Vulnerable for the duration (meaning you can only use your Base Defense to mitigate incoming damage.)

item.title: Concentrating
item.description:
Concentrating is a Persistent Condition.
Abilities with the "Concentration" Penalty (or "Concentration Abilities") impose one stack of Concentrating when they take effect and remove one stack of Concentrating when that effect ends.
All Focus Saves and Concentration Ability Tests have one Disadvantage for each stack of Concentrating that you have. If you Fail such a Test, all active Concentration Ability effects end.
If ever a Component of a Concentration Ability is affected, you must make a Focus Save.

item.title: Dazed
item.description: You cannot perform Reactions, unless they are Free Reactions.

item.title: Dead
item.description: TODO

item.title: Deafened
item.description:
1 Stack: Your cannot hear Noisy sounds. You can only hear Loud sounds as if they were Noisy. You have Disadvantage on any actions that would require hearing.
2 Stacks: You cannot hear any sounds. You automatically fail Tests that would require hearing to succeed.

item.title: Exhausted
item.description:
Exhausted is a Persistent Condition.
Abilities with the "Exhausting" Penalty (or "Exhausting Abilities") impose one stack of Exhausted if you Pass their Test.
All Exhausting Ability Tests have one Disadvantage for each stack of Exhausted that you have.

item.title: Frightened
item.description:
1 Stack: You are scared of the source of this Condition.
You must roll with Disadvantage on any actions you take that target the source of this condition.
2 Stacks: You are fully frightened. In addition to the base effect, while the source of this condition is visible, you cannot willingly move closer to it.

item.title: Grappling
item.description:
Your Abilities that target anything other than yourself or the target of your grapple have a Disadvantage.
This condition ends if:

You use a Free Action or a Reaction to end the grapple.
You and the target of your grapple are no longer in Swinging Distance of one another.
You fall Unconscious.
The target of the grapple succeeds a saving throw against this grapple.

item.title: Held
item.description:
You have been grabbed or picked up by another creature.
1 Stack: You are immobile. Your Movement is 0.
2 Stacks: You are Blunted. The source of this condition can carry you by spending double Movement.
You may retry the Grit Save against the source's Fighter Skill as:

An Action on your Turn.
A Free Reaction when the source of this condition takes damage.

item.title: Incohered
item.description:
Your temporal coherence has begun to deteriorate. General cause and effect may not work as expected.
After initiating an Ability on your turn, but before resolving any effects, roll a d6:

[3..6] The Ability hits its target, as normal.
[1..2] The Ability hits a random target within 5u of the original target. The new target does not have to satisfy any of the original ability conditions.

item.title: Mounted
item.description:
A creature has jumped on your back, got you in a chokehold, or has hitched a ride on you in some way.
1 Stack: The source of this condition is attached you to you and shares a square with you. When you take Movement on your turn, the source can use a Free Reaction to move with you.
2 Stacks: You are Blunted and Slowed(2) and can be Choked.
You may retry the Edge Save against the source's Fighter Skill as:

An Action on your Turn.
A Free Reaction when the source of this condition takes damage.

item.title: Paralyzed
item.description: TODO

item.title: Polyformed
item.description:
You have been transformed into a new creature until all stacks of this condition are cleared or your new Vitality reaches 0.
While this condition persists, your character's normal sheet is overridden, and you will instead play with your new form's Creature Sheet.
The inflictor of this condition will decide the form you take and will provide you with the Creature Sheet from the Creature List. The inflictor must chose a creature whose Level is less than the target's current Level, or zero.
The inflictor can also select a form first, then use the generic Polyform Creature Sheet to build an approximation of that creature (with GM Approval):


Polyform [Any Type]. [Tiny..Medium].
Defense [0..1]. Health [1..6]. Vitality 1.
Walk Range [5..30..50].
Other Movement. Fly Range [0, 40..60], Climb Range [0, 20..30], Burrow Range [0, 5], Swim Range [0, 20..40].
MIG [-5..2]. ART [-4..2]. TUN [-2..2].

Vision [0, 10]. Ethereal Vision 2.
Close Weapon Damage [0..2] Solid/[Blunt,Sharp]. Abilities Basic Melee Attack. Attack. Close range. Weapon Damage.

item.title: Restrained
item.description:
1 Stack: Lose 1 Beat immediately. Gain 1 less Beat per Round than usual.
2 Stacks: Lose all your Beats immediately. Gain no Beats per Round.

item.title: Sharpened
item.description: You have Advantage when using Abilities.

item.title: Silenced
item.description:
1 Stack: Your speech is faltering or weak. You have Disadvantage on all Spell Abilities.
2 Stacks: You cannot speak. You cannot use Spell Abilities.

item.title: Sleeping
item.description: TODO

item.title: Slowed
item.description:
1 Stack: Your Movement is halved (rounded down.)
2 Stacks: Your Movement is 0. You cannot move or stand up.
This condition does not itself interrupt any Movement.

item.title: Strained
item.description:
Type
Abilities with the "Straining" Penalty (or "Straining Abilities") impose one stack of Strained if you Pass their Test.
All Straining Ability Tests have one Disadvantage for each stack of Strained that you have.

item.title: Stunned
item.description:
Restrained, Slowed, and Blunted.
You have a maximum of one Beat per Round.
At two stacks: You have no Beats per Round and cannot take Free Actions or Free Reactions.
Gaining this condition interrupts flying, but not climbing, levatating, etc.

item.title: Surprised
item.description: Slowed and Blunted.

item.title: Susceptible
item.description: 1 or 2 Stack: You have a Disadvantage on all Saves.

item.title: Turned
item.description:
You can't willingly move toward the source of this condition. You only have 1 Beat per Round.
At 2 Stacks:
You must spend your turn trying to move as far away from the source of this condition as you can. You can only use your one Beat to use the Dash Ability, try to escape from an effect that prevents you from moving, or (if there's nowhere to move) use the Dodge Ability.
One stack is lost upon taking damage.

item.title: Untethered
item.description:
1 Stack: No effect.
2 Stacks: You become unstable at a planar level. Taking further planar damage may require that you roll for planar effects described by the inflicting Ability.

item.title: Vulnerable
item.description: 1 or 2 Stacks: All incoming Damage is increased by 1 (unless it was at zero.) This occurs prior to any Defenses or other modifications.

item.title: Constitution List
Constitution List
item.description:
You have 2 Vitality. When your Vitality reaches 0, you are Dead.
You start with 2 additional Trait Points and 2 additional Knowledge Skill Points.
Once you are Dead, you may use your Reaction to aid an ally if they are within 100 m of where you died by granting one of the following benefits:

Restore 1 Vitality to an ally.

Your Trait options are extended to include:
Ethervision : You can double the distance of Sensing.
Non-Mortal Daily : Select from a list of daily abilities.


You are stitched together and given an artificial soul.
When your health reaches 0, you split into 3 chunks out to 2m radius. Your core chunk can only move 1 m and when it takes damage, you lose 1 vitality. Your other pieces can move 3m, grab someone and restrict movement or impose disadvantage. Your core can cast spells that don't require somatic components.


You have a phylactery and choose the flavor of how it works. You cannot fully die till it is destroyed.


You have vampirism. Your power, as a vampire, depends on the traits purchased. All vampires use some shadow magic to protect them from the traditional vampire weaknesses. That magic fades as you do.
Your vitality can only be decreased by fire, wood stakes, and radiant/light. Sunlight also removes 1 vitality per round if your hp is at 0. If you bite someone, you regain 1 vitality.


You have swarmism and are a living swarm that has taken a humanoid form. Your power, as a living swarm, depends on the traits purchased and the swarm flavor you choose when taking this Constitution.
Your Max Health is halved. Your vitality starts at this new Max Health floor-divided by 10.
When you take this Constitution, you will choose one of the following flavors:

Flying Swarm
Crawling Swarm
Planar Swarm
You then gain the following ability:
Swarmic Evasion
Time: Reaction
When you take Vitality damage, you can use your reaction to do one of the following, depending on your swarm type:
Flying Swarm : Use your reaction to move 1 m in any direction, appearing in your Humanoid Form at the destination.
Crawling Swarm : Use your reaction to force 1 foe within touch range of you to use their reaction to move their remaining movement away from you. Does not affect creatures immune to the Fear condition.
Planar Swarm : This reaction cannot be used if the incoming damage is Ethereal or Silvered. Use your reaction to attempt to ignore the incoming damage. Roll a die and call even or odd. If you guess it correctly, the damage is ignored, otherwise you will take the damage. This reaction can be used while you are in your Swarm Form as a result of the Swarmify ability (see the Swarmify Trait.)
Swarmify
Time: Flourish
You use your Flourish to dissolve from your humanoid form into a swarm, provoking Opportunity before the rest of this ability takes effect. You then become a Living Swarm as detailed below. Your flavor changes how the swarm behaves. As a part of using this ability or as a Flourish on subsequent turns, you can choose to immediately become a humanoid again at any point within your swarm area (as detailed in the Living Swarm block below.) Size:
Flying Swarm : 3 m sphere swarm
Crawling Swarm : 4 m connected surfaces swarm
Movement : Walk 3 (+Crawling Swarm: Climb 3) (+Flying Swarm: Fly 3)
Senses : Blindsense 0 m.
Health : 0
Vitality : Redirect all to character's Vitality.
Saves, Resistances, Immunities, Languages : Use character's values.
Skills : Swarm Invasion
Choose any number of characters touching the swarm. They must make a saving throw or gain the Fear condition.
Swarm Cracks (Crawling Swarm only)
<!--Trait Ideas: * Dangerous Swarm : You can deal damage when you use your reaction. * Swarm Movement : You can become your swarm at-will. -->

You are a dead and wandering soul with some unfinished business.

item.title: Ability
item.description: An Ability is a special, predefined move that a character can make. An Ability often requires a Test and describes what effect becomes active based on the result of that Test.

item.title: Ability Skill
item.description: An Ability Skill is the skill Modifier that you will use when making the Test to determine your Score for a given Ability. If no Ability Skill is listed, then no Test is needed and the Ability is considered to have gotten a Mixed Score.

item.title: Ability Time
item.description: An Ability's Ability Time determines when the Ability can be used and how much in-game time it takes for the Ability to take effect.

item.title: Acting Skill
item.description:
Acting is a Social Skill that determines how well you can do things like:

Embody someone or something you are not.
Mimic the voice, mannerisms, etc. of a specific person.
Perform a dramatic reenactment or scene.
Fit in with local customs and etiquette.
Express basic ideas to a creature with whom you do not share a language.

item.title: Action
item.description: An Ability with an Ability Time of "Action" requires that it be your Turn and that you spend a Beat, after which the Ability's effect becomes active. If an Action is listed as a "Free Action", you do not need to spend a Beat to perform it.

item.title: Advantage
item.description:
For each Advantage that you have on a Test you will roll an additional d10. The highest d10 will then be used as the die result when calculating your Score the Test. An Advantage usually remains in effect until the circumstances that imposed it are no longer relevant. Abilities that give you an Advantage will generally describe how long it lasts.
When you have both Advantages and Disadvantages, they cancel each-other out at a rate of one-to-one. After canceling out, the total number of Advantages or Disadvantages remaining is capped at 3. This means you will only ever need 4 or fewer 10-sided dice for any one Test.
If a Critical Roll is rolled as one of the dice in a Test with an Advantage, resolve the Critical Roll for each die separately before determining which die is the highest or lowest. This may mean you get to ignore a Failing Score, as there may be a higher die result.

item.title: Alert
item.description: TODO

item.title: Archetype
item.description:
The Archetypes are a set of three upgrade tracks that grant you various benefits as you progress along each track. Each time you gain a Level, you can choose one Archetype to also gain an Archetype Level. Each Archetype Level lets you choose one Archetype Perk and may grant you Abilities related to that Archetype.
The three Archetypes are: Fighter, Rogue, and Mage.

item.title: Archetype Skill
item.description: TODO

item.title: Athletics Skill
item.description:
Athletics is a Might-based Skill that lets you do things like:

Perform more demanding or hazardous feat of sport, like acrobatics, climbing, swimming, wrestling, etc.
Climb or hold on to a slippery, unstable, or hazardous surface while something is trying to knock you off.
Say afloat in difficult waters or while something is trying to interfere with your swimming.
Lift or carry heavy objects. You can freely lift and carry objects that are your same size and weight or less. If the object is up to double your size and weight, you will need to perform a Test to try to lift and carry it. Anything larger or heavier and you will not be able to lift it without help that, with combined weight and size, can once again beat the object's own weight and size.

item.title: Attack Test
item.description:
An Attack Test is a Test that changes how much Damage an Ability does based on which Score Range is achieved. These effects may be overridden by that Ability in its description.
Score Ranges:

[0!] The Ability fails completely and has no effect(s).
[..6] You deal no Damage.
[7..9] You deal the Damage described by the Ability.
[10..] You deal the Damage described by the Ability +2.
[10!] You deal the Damage described by the Ability +4.

item.title: Basic Attack
item.description: Basic Attack refers to either the Melee Attack or the Ranged Attack from the Basic Ability List appendix.

item.title: Beat
item.description: A Beat is a resource that Player Characters and NPCs alike must spend in order to perform Abilities in an Encounter. Beats are used to perform Actions, Reactions, and Abilities with longer Ability Times.

item.title: Bonus
item.description: A Bonus describes a situation in which an Ability or Item will receive a positive addon to its usual Test or effect. Most Bonuses will give you an Advantage if the described situation holds true.

item.title: Ceremonial Name
item.description:
Your Ceremonial Name is either the first name given to you after you were born or a newer name given to you during the ritual of the Ceremony Spell Ability.
Abilities that list "Ceremonial Name" as a Requirement will fail if the user of that Ability does not know and say aloud the true Ceremonial Name of the target creature.

item.title: Character Sheet
item.description: A Character Sheet is the primary reference sheet for the capabilities of a Player Character. Each Character Sheet lays out a unique set of capabilities. Together with the dice, the Character Sheet contains most of the information you will need to play that character (aside from knowing the basic rules, of course.)

item.title: Charm Skill
item.description:
Charm is a Social Skill that determines how well you can do things like:

Impress with flattery, flirting, or a show of toughness.
Convince someone to look favorably upon someone or something other than yourself.

item.title: Class
item.description: TODO

item.title: Class Ability
item.description: A Class Ability is a type of Ability that can be automatically gained as you gain Levels. When choosing new Class Abilities, you must ensure that you take more from your chosen Class than any other single Class.

item.title: Closing Credits
item.description:
The Closing Credits occur at the end of each Episode. The Closing Credits begin with each Player optionally roleplaying a "resolution" style scenes, where their Player Character discusses the Episode's events with other Player Characters or NPCs of their choice, like their friends or family.
After that, you can rest and reset many values on your Character Sheet. Below is the starting list of things to reset:

Set your Recoveries at their maximum.
Set your Dodge Points and Shield to the maximum (see the Rest Ability.)
Set your Health and Vitality to their maximums.
Clear all Status Conditions.
Reset all other Point Banks are reset.
If two Episodes are closer together in time, the GM may modify what all you can reset.

item.title: Component
item.description:
#point_banks #point_banks #point_banks #constitution
Some Abilities will list Components needed by the Ability. Components can be generic things like hands or standing, or a specific type of point you must spend from one of the #point_banks on your Character Sheet (Note: Your Shield, Health, and Vitality are #point_banks. You may also have #point_banks unique to your Class or #constitution.) If points are listed, then you must spend that many points before the Ability can be rolled for.
If you are lacking a Component when it comes time to roll the Ability's Skill Test, you will receive a Disadvantage for every missing Component. Note that that means that Abilities with an Ability Time greater than one Beat will only need to meet their Components when spending the final Beat needed to fulfill the Ability's Ability Time. This includes Slow Actions.
Unlike Requirements, Components also need to remain unaffected for the entire Effect Duration as well. If a Component is interrupted at any point during your Effect Duration, you will need to re-roll the Ability's Skill Test and get a Mixed Score or the Ability's effects will immediately end. This Test is performed for each Component that was interrupted.
If one of the Components is a Point Bank, that Point Bank gains a soft lock (often tracked with a small token.) If that Point Bank changes, up or down, that change counts as an interruption of the Component.
It is worth noting that the Component 'Concentration' adds a second layer of difficulty. Concentration imposes a Disadvantage to an Ability's initial Ability Skill Tests for each other active Concentration Ability.

item.title: Concentration
item.description:
Abilities with the "Concentration" Penalty (or "Concentration Abilities") impose one stack of Concentrating when they take effect and remove one stack of Concentrating when that effect ends.
All Focus Saves and Concentration Ability Tests have one Disadvantage for each stack of Concentrating that you have. If you Fail such a Test, all active Concentration Ability effects end.
If ever a Component of a Concentration Ability is affected, you must make a Focus Save.

item.title: Conjuring Skill
item.description:
Conjuring is a Tuning-based Skill that allows you to do things like:

Recall information about magic that involves conjuring. This includes spells that call forth the elements out of thin air, summon entities from beyond, and bring forth images in the mind.
Recall information about animals, plants, and other living things and their innate, natural or magical abilities. This includes gods and primordial beings, such as elementals, demons, fiends, celestials, and arch-fey, provided that they did not rise to their position.

item.title: Constitution
item.description: TODO

item.title: Contest
item.description:
A Contest involves two parties performing a head-to-head Test, directly compare their Scores afterward to determine the winner. If one party's Score is higher, that party wins the Contest. If both Scores are a tie, a coin toss is used to determine the winner.
Some Contests will use a Score Range shorthand in their description:

[Win] Takes effect if you get the higher Score in the Contest.
[Lose] Takes effect if you get the lower Score in the Contest.

item.title: Core Fleeting Condition
item.description:
The Core Fleeting Conditions are the Status Conditions: Bloodied, Blunted, Charmed, Dazed, Frightened, Restrained, Silenced, Slowed, Susceptible, and Vulnerable.
Whenever you gain a Wound or if you are hit by certain Abilities, you will need to perform a Wound Test that will randomly give you one of the Core Fleeting Conditions. In the case of a Wound, you will gain the condition as a Persistent Condition instead of a Fleeting Condition.

item.title: Covert Skill
item.description: The Covert Skills are a subset of the Exploration Skills focused on stealth and subterfuge. The three Covert Skills are Sneaking, Sleight, and Hiding.

item.title: Creature
item.description: A Creature is any entity in the game that has Health or Vitality and some level sentience. All Player Characters and NPCs count as Creatures.

item.title: Critical Roll
item.description:
A critical roll occurs when a ten-sided die lands on '10' (often labeled as '0' on the die.) You must then flip a coin. If you call it correctly, that die is a critical success, otherwise it is a critical failure.

You performed flawlessly. In some rare instances, you may still fall short of your intended goal, but you will likely bring about an additional, positive side effect.

You performed dismally. In some rare instances, you may still achieve your intended goal, but you will likely bring about some additional, adverse effect.
